He has worked in a farm for most of his life, and he learned all his knowledge thanks to his family who work in similar activities. He lives in the Municipality of Dabeiba where he shares his life with his wife. He is requesting a loan to buy manure, water for irrigation, coffee seeds and fungicides, looking for ways to improve and increase his production, because he is a dreamer and he plans to have more successful crops.

loans.use: to buy manure, water for irrigation, coffee seeds and fungicides, looking for ways to improve and increase his production.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Elisabeth est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses trois enfants à Avédji. Pour entreprendre une activité et disposer d’un revenu pour répondre à ses besoins, Elisabeth vend des chaussures dans son quartier. Elisabeth achète deux fois par mois au marché ses chaussures pour revendre à ses clients. Pour acheter de nouvelles chaussures, Elisabeth demande ce crédit pour financer sa commande afin de satisfaire agréablement ses clients et trouver le bénéfice pour permettre à ses enfants une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is 45 year-old woman who is married and lives with her three children in Avédji. In order to make a living, Elisabeth sells shoes in her neighborhood. She buys shoes at the market twice a month and then resells them. 

Elisabeth is requesting this loan to stock up on a shoes, meet customer demand properly and earn a revenue allowing her to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 51 years old and has three children and is really attached to her family. Her husband is the main income provider in the family.  He works as a mechanic to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. 

Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children's educational fees. One of her greatest dreams is to see them achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a Kiva borrower. He operates a retail business where he sells rice, flour, sugar, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are regular. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar and other items. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Jonatan Arley

texts.es:
Jonatan es hombre de 19 años. Aparte a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3 años. 

Ella aprendió este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de observación de otras personas. 

El y su familia viven una zona rural de Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que aporta Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo va usar para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para poder preparar sus cultivos. 

Gracias a este crédito, la economía de su familia y la calidad de vida mejorarían pues pudiera aumentar sus ingresos.

¡Impacte la vida de Jonatan y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Jonatan is a 19 year old man who has been working in agriculture, independently from his family, for 3 years. He learned to do this by himself, that is by watching other people. He and his family live in a rural area of Colombia where it is not easy to access financial services like those that Interactuar offer.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs like seeds. pest control products and manure to prepare his crops. Thanks to this loan the family economy and quality of living will improve as he can increase his income. Have an impact on the life of Jonatan and his family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like seeds. pest control products and manure to prepare his crops.

loans.name: Tata

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Tata, one of Ruma agents. Tata lives in Lebak, a village located at Banten province, about 4-5 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his children (one daughter and one son). 

Tata owns a stall that sells daily consumer products, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services (like electricity, water, etc) to his community. Even though Lebak is still in Java Island and really near from Jakarta, but the infrastructure is not as good as Jakarta, that's why Tata's community really need him so they can have access to communication and financial services. 

As the business grows, Tata needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Tata's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Tata is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his village community.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina de 43 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tiene 6 hijos pero solo 4 viven en casa y los demás son independientes.

Reina se dedica a la elaboración y venta  de pan  desde hace 9 años, el oficio lo aprendió con su madre quien tenía un negocio similar, Reina trabaja con un horno artesanal y elabora el pan durante las mañanas y una de sus hijas es quien se involucra en el trabajo.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar harina, huevos, azúcar, sal, levadura, aceite, leche, etc. para la elaboración de pan.


Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y tener más demanda de clientes, espera mejorar su casa con las ganancias de su trabajo.
texts.en: Reina, 43, has a third grade education. She is married, and her husband is a bricklayer.  She has six children, but only four live at home, and the others are independent.  Reina has been engaged in making and selling bread for nine years.  She learned the trade from her mother who had a similar business.  Reina works with an artisanal oven and makes the bread in the morning.  One of her daughters is also involved in the work.  She needs the loan to purchase wheat, eggs, sugar, salt, yeast, oil, milk, and other ingredients to make the bread.  Her dream is to grow her business and have more customer demand, and she hopes to improve her home with the profits from her work.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, eggs, sugar, salt, yeast, oil, milk, and other ingredients to make the bread.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN CASADA QUE SE ENCUENTRA ESPERANDO A SU PRIMER HIJO, EL EMBARAZO RESULTO DE ALTO RIESGO POR LO QUE TUVO QUE RENUNCIAR A SU TRABAJO. SU ESPOSO TRABAJA SIN EMBARGO SUS INGRESOS SON MUY BAJOS. ELLA DEBERA SOMETERSE A UNA CESAREA PARA QUE SU BEBE NAZCA SIN RIESGO.
texts.en: She is a young married woman who is expecting her first child. The pregnancy was high risk, so she had to quit her job. Her husband works, however their income is very low. She has to have a C-section so that her baby can be born without risk.

loans.use: to have a baby via C-section.

loans.name: Achileo

texts.en:
Achileo is a married man, aged 32 years, with four children, two of whom are currently attending school. He lives in a rural setting with his family. 

Achileo deals in agriculture, mostly growing coffee and watermelons and he supplements his family income with boda boda riding and rentals. He works six days a week on his farm and each day he works for six hours. He started his business in 2000 with the aim of getting money to provide family income since necessities were increasingly needed by his family. 

He has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizer and herbicide for coffee plantations.

His clients are traders from surrounding towns and his dream is to be the leading producer of agricultural products in his area. His biggest challenges are lack of sufficient capital, pests, diseases, and price changes for agricultural products which are not stable.

Achileo is a hard-working man.

loans.use: to boost his coffee production by buying farm inputs.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 53 years old and he is married. He has 10 children, 5 girls and 5 boys and all of them go to schools and universities while others graduated from University and work for the government.

Ismail wants to invest his farm by farming vegetables and other crops. The farm's location is at Gabiley district and suitable for farming by using irrigation water. Ismail want to farm cash crop and then sell to Gabiley market.

He needs to increase the production of his farm, so Ismail is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kaaba MFI to use water engine,seeds and other farming equipment's. In future Ismail wants to increase the farm’s production and the sales his production.

loans.use: To investment his crop production farm

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 34 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children who are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time.  Her husband is the main income provider in the family and is a soldier in the Lebanese to help his beloved family to live in good conditions. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school

loans.name: Acham Beatrice Anwie

texts.en:
Acham is married with five children and they live in a five room house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced one problem being the death of her sister. 

With the new loan requested, she will buy chicks, feed for the chicks, firewood and pay for the splitting of the firewood. She has a positive view about the business succeeding.  She has been in the business for quite some time; she has a ready market with many costumers and belief that God will see her through. 

The community will benefit from this activity in that the people will not have to go distances to buy and firewood will be available at all times for cooking.
The profit realized from this loan will be used to increase the size of the business, raise the living standards of the family and provide for children school fees and medication.

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates; the marketing techniques obtained during training and they also teach on how to manage capital well in business.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed for the chicks, firewood and pay for the splitting of the firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried maize for selling

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 45 years old and she supports three children. She has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 20,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops to enable her to get a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus to clients in the market.

She plans to use the profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and repay the loan. Her hope is to expand her agricultural sector and cater to her children's education and medication.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing her crops to enable her to get a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus to clients in the market.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 46 years old and she supports four children.

She has been a poultry keeper for the last four years and the business earns her KES 4,100 per month.

Rhoda has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase an additional supply of poultry for egg production and sales.

She plans to use the gained profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, to educate her children and also provide better medication for them.

Her hope is to improve her living standards so they are stable and expand her agricultural sector through purchasing a hatchery for hatching more chicks to sell.

loans.use: to purchase an additional supply of poultry for egg production and sales.

loans.name: Bainomugisa Group

texts.en: Sharon is a laboratory assistant in Kagadi Uganda and owns a lab. Age 26 years old, she has been in this business for four years. She also does farming to enable her to make ends meet. She dreams of buying land and educating her two children in the future. She wants a loan to buy lab reagents. Sharon is a member of Bainomugisa group where members guarantee each other to get a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy materials for her laboratory.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is aged 40 years and he supports 4 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last year and the business earns him about  KES 9,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional stock of soft drinks for resale.

Jared plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and expand his business. 

His hope is to be financially stable and educate his child.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Rega

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rega, one of Ruma agents. Rega lives in Lebak, a village located at Banten province, about 4-5 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his only child. 

Rega owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services (like electricity, water, etc) to his community. Even though Lebak is still in Java Island and really near from Jakarta, but the infrastructure is not as good as Jakarta, that's why Rega's community really need him so they can have access to communication and financial services. 

As the business grows, Rega needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Rega's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later, his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Rega is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for his local community.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and is currently living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide, volunteering every week at her local secondary school teaching a life skills class. Caroline is doing a poultry project. Apart from poultry supply, she also provide her community with cooked food.Caroline already repaid her 500 USD loan with success. She hopes to take another 1,000 USD loan so that she can increase her sales. She hopes to further expand her poultry project and also to to offer a variety of food at her takeaway where she provide food to her community.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, drugs, and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and install a composting toilet facility and connect piped water to his house.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith resides in the town of Chiredzi, Zimbabwe, where she volunteers at a community hostel for girls who walk long distances to school. When she got her $500 loan, Judith purchased more stock for her flea market, where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She hopes to get another Kiva loan so that she can further expand her business. She hopes to raise enough money to support her two children and three siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 26-year-old businesswoman residing in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe. Since both of her parents passed away, she is the breadwinner in her family. Viola is a well-known volunteer in her community who works to keep children in school. She owns and runs a flea market stand at the local business centre, where she sells clothing, accessories, and shoes. After receiving a $500 loan from Kiva last year, Viola expanded her business and bought more clothing to sell. She would now like to take a larger loan to further expand her business. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her younger brother and to build a house for her family.

Viola said, “I really appreciate what Kiva has already done because the loan has transformed my life.” Her desire is to further her education and study business management so that she can further contribute to the development and sustainability of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tariro

texts.en: Tariro is a 30-year-old mother from the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, she helps young students develop life skills. As a businesswoman, Tariro sells chickens to the community. She repaid her $500 loan in time. After receiving her loan, Tariro increased her poultry production. She hopes to get another Kiva loan so that she can further expand her poultry project. She desires to build a bigger fowl run so that she can expand her poultry business.She hopes that if her poultry business expands, she will get more profits and upgrade her living standards. She also desires to further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and vaccines.

loans.name: Yesayi

texts.en:
Yesayi repaid his first Kiva loan and already has ideas for second partnership. He is 23 years old and he lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik, with his father (who is a driver). Yesayi has no higher education, but he is skilled farmer already. 

Yesayi now has a beautiful farm, where he has cows, a calf, a piglet, and chickens, and a plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, beans and greens. Yesayi sells his farm products such as milk, meat, eggs and vegetables, at the city wholesale market. 

This young man mentions that he loves his farm and feels great responsibility for its proper care. This Kiva loan Yesayi asks for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel for his land activities and also fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel for his land activities and also fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is 34 years old and married to Norah, and he supports a family of three children. 

He has been providing transport services via his motorcycle for the last 5 years, earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Zachary has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production. He will be able to supply milk to distant customers via his motorcycle hence make more sales.

Zachary plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a retail shop. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 43 years old and married to Marcella, and he supports four children. He has been selling firewood for the the last 12 years, and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase trees for making firewood to sell.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and to expand his business. 

His hopes are to be financially stable and to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase trees for making firewood to sell

loans.name: Jairo De Jesus

texts.es:
Jairo, un campesino muy amoroso y de gran pasión por la naturaleza, trabaja con animales, pero no sacrificándolos ni vendiéndolos solamente, trabaja con la leche de las vacas; es tanta la admiración y respeto por los animales que prefiere que mueran por vejez antes de tener que sacrificarles para conseguir una rentabilidad por su carne. 

Es padre de  hijo, trabaja con el enseñándole la pasión por el campo, por amar la naturaleza y el amor por los animales. 

Pensando en su vivienda y en sus hijos, Jairo quiere expandirse y por tal motivo tiene un dinero juntado para comprar una vaca lechera por lo que requiere un crédito para ajustar el total del dinero para la compra de la vaca. 

Con la ayuda de esta vaca tendrá más producción lechera garantizando una vida económica estable para el futuro de él y su familia. 

Sueña con tener una finca con mucho ganado rodearse de estos mamíferos que le ayudan a llevar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo, a loving farmer with a great passion for nature, works with animals. He does not slaughter nor sell them, he only works with the milk from the cows. He has so much admiration and respect for the animals that he prefers to let them die of old age before having to slaughter them in order to get a profit from their meat.

He is the father of a son. He works with him teaching him his passion for the land, to love nature and love the animals.

Thinking of his home and children he wants to expand and for that reason he has collected capital to buy a dairy cow but he needs a loan to add to the total money in order to buy the cow. With the help of this cow he will have greater milk production helping to ensure a stable economic life for himself and his family.

He dreams of having a farm with many cattle, being surrounded by these mammals that help him to earn a living for his family.

loans.use: to add to the amount of money he has so that he can buy a cow

loans.name: Marie Aime

texts.en:
Marie Aime is 36 years old. She is married with three children aged between 1 and 6 years. 1 of them go to school.

She owns a shop, and she has been in business for two years, while her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, and salt to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she aims to earn at least 300,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Bubandi 111 Group

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with four children; three of them attend school in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a cocoa trader mainly buying cocoa for sale. She started her business in 2000 with an aim of taking care of her family needs, and gets additional income from her cocoa garden. She requests a loan to buy cocoa beans to sell, and to raise enough for school fees for her children. Her family dream is educating her children to university level and building a good house, while her business dream is expanding her cocoa business to new markets. She is a member of Bubandi 111 group, where members guarantee each other to get loans.

The extra 5 people in photo are group members with savings who have guaranteed their fellows but have not taken the loan this time.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 25-year-old businesswoman. She has one child and lives in the Mudzi district of Zimbabwe. Juliet is into buying and selling of groceries in her community. The business is doing well, since when she was given a loan she relocated her grocery shop to a remote place where there were no shops.

She has provided convenience to community members. She has created employment for one young lady from her community who assisted her during her absence. She also used her profits to buy basic commodities for the family members, since she is the breadwinner.

Juliet is planning to open a big shop in her community. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase cartons of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks to boost sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks to boost sales and profits.

loans.name: Dottade

texts.fr: Dottade est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Dottade vit  à Adidogomé pour entreprendre son activité. Elle vend des bassines en plastiques et en alluminium en parcourant le quartier et les marchés. Dottade s’approvisionne deux fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour acheter des bassines. Dottade désire réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Dottade is a 30-year-old married mother to four children. She lives in Avedji so she can carry out her business, which involves selling plastic and aluminium bowls both as a street vendor and at market. Dottade gets her supplies twice per month. She is requesting this loan to purchase more bowls. She wishes to make enough profit to be able to support her husband with their family's expenses. She also wants to be able to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 31 bowls

loans.name: Aljiris Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALJIRIS” lleva dos ciclos en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa venta de frazadas, venta de cosméticos, venta de dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela  es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace siete años trabajando como ayudante de cocina.

El préstamo que sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ALJIRIS” communal bank is in their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. It is made up of eight members lead by a board of directors with Adela as President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Amongst them are: food sales, selling clothing, selling blankets, cosmetic sales and selling sweets.

The loan will benefit all of these micro entrepreneurs of which Adela is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago at the invitation of a promoter from the institution. She currently has a business selling food. She says that she learned the business in seven years of work as an assistant cook.

The loan that she is taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying rice and noodles wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesalers of the city of El Alto and later after preparing them, sell them in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the training and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice and noodles wholesale.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora, 36 years old, is the mother of four school children. She has been running a food business commonly known as a mamalishe. She works from 6 am until 23 pm every day and is able to make a good profit each month. Through hard work, she managed to earn enough to pay for household expenses and school fees. In the coming years, Dora would like to build a house for her family. Dora will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business. This is her second loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, which she repaid successfully, to buy food items like rice, sugar, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Dalina

texts.en:
Dalina is a 35 year old Lebanese married woman with four children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family. He owns a small grocery store in his town. 

Dalina at this stage is in real need of a little help from Kiva. For that reason, she is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children's educational fees. She said that she is happy that she will be able to continue her children's education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees

loans.name: Actilius

texts.en:
Actilius is 32 years old, married and supports five people in his family, together with his wife.

He operates a motorbike transport, a business he has been doing for the last five years, and generates a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Actilius has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase a new motorcycle in hopes that it will enable him to serve more customers and generate more income to support his family. 

He will use the anticipated profit to support his family by providing for their basic needs such as food.

His future hopes and dreams are to have an expanded business and make more income so as to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle in hopes that it will enable him to serve more customers and generate more income to support his family.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, who is 50 years old, is married, with one child who is in school. Aida makes her family's living by running a business of household properties. She does the business from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and she is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

From Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Aida's twentieth loan request, which she will use to restock on household properties resell. With her previous loans, all of which were successfully paid back, Aida bought the same stock to service more people. She used the increased income to cover school fees and home food expenses, and she bought a TV, mattress, sofa set, and radio. She is so happy and thankful to everyone who has supported her. She dreams of building a house for her family. Aida will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock on household properties resell

loans.name: Gor

texts.en: Gor lives in the village of Ddmashen, in the Gegharkunik region, with his mother and school-aged brother. Gor is 30 years old, and he has higher education, with a specialty in economics. He has worked in different places but now he is engaged in farming and agriculture. He has cows, sheep and chickens on his farm. With the help of his mother, he sells milk, meat and eggs, as well as his own potatoes, tomatoes, greens and peppers. Gor will be very thankful and happy if Kiva lenders help him with a loan, which he will use to develop his potato production. With the loan, he will buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel, as well as fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel, as well as fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle, which he intends to hire out. He is still in transport and does farming, growing seasonal crops. He faces hardships of poor roads, especially during rainy seasons where roads become impassable. 

However, he is working very hard to make sure he constructs a residential house. 

Patrick needs a loan to buy land to construct a residential house.

loans.use: to buy land to construct a residential house.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, flour, sugar, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. 

This is her third  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.en: Lorena is 37 years old and lives with her husband in Envigado, just south of Medellín, where she has been selling beauty products and clothing accessories for the past five years. She is very hardworking, never taking a day off, and attending to her clients for up to eight hours a day. She wishes to use this loan to add more items to her inventory, so that she can create sustainability for her business and create more jobs for others. She dreams of living in a home that will provide her with better living conditions, and she hopes that this venture will propel her to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to add more items to her inventory.

loans.name: Argelio De Jesus

texts.en: Argelio is 41 years old and lives in the rural town of Santa Barbara, Itagüí, with his 11-year-old twin sons. He runs a farm passed down by his father, and he works every day of the week except for Sunday, when he enjoys spending time with his family. He would like to use this loan to buy more fertilizer, so as to increase his production and consequently boost his sales. He hopes that this investment will also provide greater sustainability for the foreseeable future. Argelio dreams that one day his hard work will pay off, and that he will be able to buy a new home to live in, so that he can provide his young boys with a happier, more stable, future.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and increase the yield of his farm.

loans.name: Pendarima De Koanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme ODETTE est responsable du groupe  PENGDARIMA DE KOANGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 12 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Madame fait le commerce de boisson alcoolisée depuis 30 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 20 sacs de mil (sorgho rouge) et 02 charrettes de bois.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne être plus tard une grande commerçante.
texts.en: Odette is the leader of the Pendarima De Koanga Group. A married woman, she is the mother of five children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 12. Three go to school and she has two people living in her care. Odette has been making and selling millet beer for 30 years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. She wants to purchase 20 sacks of millet (red sorghum) and two carts of firewood. She plans on using her profits to invest in her business. Her ambition is to become a major brewer.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of millet (red sorghum) and two carts of firewood

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 25 ans, Amélé est une femme mère de deux  enfants. Amélé habite à Adidogomé et vend des chaussures en se promenant dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins,  s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local de Lomé. Pour commander des cartons de chaussures,  demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amélé is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells shoes by walking through the neighborhood. She does this to earn the income necessary for her family to thrive. To meet her needs, she buys supplies two times a month in the local market in Lomé. 

Amélé is asking for this loan so that she can order her boxes of shoes. The income she earns will allow her to help her husband with their children's education.

loans.use: buy 22 handbags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Leni, one of Ruma's agents. Leni lives in Cianjur, located in West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her three children (two sons and one daughter). Leni owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories to her community. Her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile airtime provider.
.
As the business grows, Leni needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. 

Leni’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Leni is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her village community.

loans.name: Elton

texts.en:
Meet 23-year-old Elton. He is jovial and enjoys interacting with people. He is the first of two children. Elton has successfully completed training in Lilongwe, Malawi to start running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business. Elton is very excited for this opportunity. He is requesting a loan to set up his business so that he can provide financial services to people in Malomo. Malomo is a small town in the central province of Malawi and people there do not have a lot of financial services.

With this loan, Elton will be able to purchase a Zoona-branded kiosk and a mobile phone. The loan will also ensure that Elton has money to serve his customers. The kiosk will be used to serve customers in Malomo, as most of the people are unbanked. Zoona has done market research in Malomo and has determined that the location for this kiosk is ideal. Elton will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in town and a large number of families will be using his service. This opportunity to run his own business means a lot to Elton. He will have some income to cater to his basic needs. He is hopeful that he will become financially stable through this business and hopes to be able to send money back home to his mother.

loans.use: to start a mobile money transfer business in his community in Malomo, Malawi.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Abaita Ababiri in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. 

For the past six years, Florence has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which deals in sewing clothes. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a second sewing machine. This will help Florence to generate greater profits and add more to her business so as to attract her customers. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to have her children in the best schools. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy a second sewing machine

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, who is in his late 30s, is married. She has been running a genge duka (a retail shop with fruits and vegetables) for six t years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Stella's tenth  loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to  improved her shop and to restock the out-of-stock items. She is doing great. s

She used the profit to take care of her family and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase the genge duka stock. She dreams of owning a big shop .  Stella will make sure she pays the loan at the scheduled time.

loans.use: to increase the genge duka stock.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be committed. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics for salon use. 

Her business goal is to have a business with high returns within five years.The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged between 25 and 27 years. One of them goes to school and he is in private school. She owns a pharmacy and she has been doing in a business for the past five years, while her husband is businessman also. 

She is requesting a school fees loan and she would like to pay in installments. After paying school fees, she plans to expand her business in order to prepare her  better future.

loans.use: To pay for school fees in installments.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years. Her potential customers are her neighbours and people at the marketplace. She mentioned lack of capital as a major challenge in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase chemicals,hair products and lotions for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, hair products and lotions

loans.name: Alex Francisco

texts.es:
Alex, junto a su esposa ha podido formar una unidad familiar y productiva bastante fuerte, ya que no solo prima el amor si no también los deseos de salir adelante y progresar como familia.

El se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos de levante, es una actividad aprendida de su esposo quien actualmente se dedica a esta actividad y ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos durante mucho tiempo.

El pide un auxilio económico para comprar algunos cerdos pequeños e irlos cuidando y criando para posteriormente venderlos.

Es un hombre soñador y con gran voluntad, tanto así que ya piensa en grande y desea tener una marranera con gran capacidad.

Tiene gran ilusión y expectativa con este proyecto y confía en el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para crecer como empresaria.

En tus manos esta que el negocio de Alex prospere en el tiempo, Anímate!
texts.en:
Alex and his wife have been able to form a productive and quite strong family unit, as they value not just love but also the desire to succeed and make progress as a family. 

He raises and sells pigs and chickens, a livelihood he learned from his wife, who currently works in this activity, and which has been the main source of their income for a long time.

He is requesting financial assistance to buy some piglets; to raise and look after them for later sale.

He is a forward-looking man with a strong will, so much so that he already has big plans and wants to have a large capacity pig operation.

He has great hopes and dreams for this project, and trusts in the kind-hearts of the Kiva lenders to help him grow as a businessman.

It is in your hands whether Alex's business will prosper in time. Go for it!

loans.use: To buy some piglets; to raise and look after them for later sale.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en: Maria is 60 years old and lives in Bello with her husband and son, where she sells clothes to local customers. She is extremely hardworking, and she can be found in her store every day of the week, for 7 hours a day. She would like to take out a small loan of 600,000 COP (Colombian pesos) in order to buy extra inventory, especially more men’s shirts. Maria aims to become more competitive in the local clothing market and aspires to open another store soon, provided this loan can help her increase her sales and increase her clientele base. Ultimately, she dreams of refurbishing her home so that her family can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy extra inventory, especially more men’s shirts.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.en: Rosalba is 56 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello, where she has been making and selling arepas (corn tortillas) to local customers since 2012. She wishes to take out a loan so that she can repair the grill in her kitchen and keep on making delicious products for her clientele. She hopes this will also allow her to become more competitive in the local market, and that customers will choose her products over others. Rosalba is extremely hardworking; she never takes a day off, and she spends 10 hours a day in her kitchen so that she can provide herself with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the grill in her kitchen so she can make more corn tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a new client in UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She is a married woman with children.

She is a business woman baking cakes. In bid to increase her working capital/expand the business, she has applied for a loan of ugx500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy baking ingredients such as baking flour, sugar and other ingredients to increase her products. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital.

Amina is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her, since she is now able to fund and sustain her business.

loans.use: to boost her bakery by  buying more ingredients.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells tyres. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tyres. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tyres

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ade, one of Ruma's agents. He lives in Cianjur, West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his children (one son and one daughter). He owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories. His community sees him as a trusted and kind mobile provider.

As the business grows, Ade needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones. Ade’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan, so later, his community not only can have access to communication service, but also access to buy high quality products with lower prices. Ade is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his village community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en: Joweria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works for seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT–SACC0 to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes transportation and seasonality, which hinders her movements. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a business women and she has a small shop, so she is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her shop such as rice, aqua, cooking oils, biscuits, eggs, milk, noodles, sardines, soy sauce, shampoo, Including soft drinks and other things to sell.
 Rosita started to open her shop in 2012 with her own working capital of $250.00. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy rice, aqua, cooking oils, biscuits, eggs, milk, noodles, sardines, soy sauce, shampoo, including soft drinks and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya is 52 years old and she lives in Gagarin village of Gegharkunik region. She lives here with her husband and son; both of them are unemployed and they help each other in farming activities. Ofelya also never did any work different from farming and she can surely say that she is master in it. 

In her farm she has cows, a calf, rabbits, sheep and chickens. She sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and eggs to her regular customers from the district. 

Ofelya asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams in order to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Humberto

texts.en: Humberto is a Kubo Financiero client, these is his second loan.  He has been paying the first one on time and now is asking for an additional loan to continue investing in his business. Humberto likes to save money and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sale

loans.name: Gladys Aurora

texts.es:
Gladys, de 49 años, inicio con un negocio de internet hace aproximadamente 1 año con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus tres hijos y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.
Hoy en día sus hijos se han convertido en la alegría de esta mujer trabajadora.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de equipos de cómputo, cubículos y elementos de papelería.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a sus hijos brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Gladys para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Gladys, who is 49 years old, began an internet cafe business about one year ago, with the ambition of starting a business that would generate income for her and allow her to survive. Now, her motivation to work tirelessly is her three children, for whom she hopes to provide the best for their life and development. Today, her children have become the greatest joy of this hardworking woman. 

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of computer equipment, cubicles, and paper supplies. With this loan, she will be able to support her business and her children, giving them a better quality of life. Support Gladys so that she can continue with her business!

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment, cubicles, and paper supplies.

loans.name: Wunbiyali - Kunkuna / Bimbilla Group

texts.en:
Katumi is a 45-year-old married mother of 4 children living in Bimbilla in the northern region of Ghana. Katumi is a member of a rice processing group called ‘Wunbiyali – Kunkuna/Bimbilla’. She is the individual pictured standing at the back with the hand raised in the group photo.
Katumi has been in the rice processing business for about 7 years now with 3 employees working with her. Katumi enjoys her business and hopes to mobilize enough capital to grow her business. 

Katumi and her group have requested for a loan of GHS11400.00. Her own share of the loan is GHS400.00 which she would use to buy paddy rice from local farmers for processing to meet the demand in the home market.

Katumi loves to make her children happy by providing them with their educational needs from the proceeds she gets from her business. Her children are happy to see their mother active in business because their needs are met which always makes Katumi’s family happy. Katumi is very thankful to kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from local farmers for processing to meet the demand in the home market.

loans.name: Jhon Alex

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la agricultura.
Él es emprendedor, constante, fuerte, paciente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad “Sacaba’ un área rural caracterizada por ser centro de acopio de la producción agrícola como; frutas, verduras, carne, etc., y por sus parques eco-turísticos y educativos como una alternativa a los urbanos y tradicionales. De clima templado durante todo el año con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 7-23 grados centígrados.
Jhon es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus familiares que trabajan la tierra, viven en una casa construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que se encuentra sin finalizar y cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba. Su trabajo es la siembra y cosecha de hoja de coca, él cuenta con 1 cato de coca que equivale a 1600 metros cuadrados (40x40). El lugar donde vive es rural cercana a la ciudad, los pobladores extraen agua de pozos o la recogen del río, actualmente las aguas del río ya no sirven para consumo, “nuestra necesidad es el agua en la cocina porque el agua de rio esta contaminada…” comenta. La ventaja de su vivienda es que se encuentra cercana a las recientes conexiones de agua, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para concluir su conexión de agua potable. Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa, Él desea realizar la conexión de agua potable para su baño, cocina y lavandería; y dejar de usar agua de pozo, para brindarle a su familia agua sana para vivir. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que está construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Jhon solicita un préstamo para la conexión de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que su familia consuma agua sana.
texts.en:
Jhon is a single 26 year old man with no children. He works in agriculture. He is enterprising, consistent, strong, patient, optimistic responsible and very hard-working. He does his work in “Sacaba’ a rural area that is known as a production center for agricultural products like fruit, vegetables, meat, etc. and for it's ecological and educational tourist parks which are an alternative to the urban and traditional forms. It has a temperate climate throughout the year with a temperature that varies during the day from 7 to 23 degrees Celsius.

Jhon is dark-skinned, has dark eyes, short black hair, is short in stature and of medium build. His native language is Quechua which he speaks in his home and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for his work.

He shares his life with his family who work the earth. They live in a house made of wood with a metal roof and a dirt floor and is not yet completed. They have electricity and well water that is pumped up. His work is growing and harvesting coca leaves. He has one cato of land which is equivalent to 1600 square meters (40 by 40 meters)

The place where he lives is rural but close to the city. The inhabitants get water from wells or from the river. Actually the water is not fit for consumption. "Our need is for water in the kitchen as the river water is contaminated" he says. The advantage of his house is that it is close to recent water connections and his disadvantage is the lack of money to connect to the running water.

His dream is to finish the construction of his house. He wants to undertake the water connection for his kitchen, bathroom and laundry to stop using well water and provide his family with healthy water to live. This is his first loan with the institution in the five years that he has been building his house. For these reasons Jhon is requesting a loan to connect running water to his kitchen, bathroom and laundry so that his family uses healthy water.

loans.use: to connect running water to his kitchen, bathroom and laundry so that his family uses healthy water.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman who has no children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a printing business for the past four years, serving students and neighbors. With the loan, she wants to purchase printing papers and a small printer for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her printing business.

loans.use: to purchase printing papers and a small printer for her business.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en: Koba is 41 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, two children and pensioner mother in Lanchkhuti district. Koba is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two cows, two calves and a plot of agricultural land where he grows maize and nut trees. Koba works hard to insure a good harvest, which is sold at local markets. Koba wants to open a cafe and requested a loan. The Startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan and purchase all the needed equipment and products to open a cafe. He will run the cafe and will be able to generate a stable income. Koba awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a cafe and generate a stable income.

loans.name: Eva Yamileth

texts.es:
Eva, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.  

Eva, es una persona dedicada a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar a sus hijos, pero también ayuda a su esposo en el cultivo de granos básicos y cultivo de hortalizas.  

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y foliares para el cultivo de sandía,  ellos comenzaran a limpiar la tierra para comenzar a sembrar lo granos básicos.  

Eva, sueña con que sus hijos estudien y lleguen a graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Eva is 31 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has only a fourth-grade education. She is in a long-term relationship and has three children. Her partner earns his living in agriculture. 

Eva takes care of the children and the household chores, but she also helps her spouse farm staple crops and fruits and vegetables. She needs the loan to buy fertilizers and foliar fertilizers for their watermelon crop. They will start clearing the land in order to begin planting the staple crops. 

Eva dreams of her children going to school and earning a university degree.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and foliar fertilizers for her watermelon crop

loans.name: Nelson De Jesus

texts.en:
Nelson is 60 years old and lives with his 18 year old daughter in the municipality of Bello, located just north of Medellín. He makes a living as a carpenter, producing various woodworks for his local clients. 

He would like to use this loan to purchase extra wood, new paint and a compressor. He hopes that these products will help increase his production and sales and make his business more effective and organized.

Nelson dreams of providing his daughter with a better home to live in, so that she can enjoy a happier, more stable future.

loans.use: to purchase extra wood, new paint and a compressor

loans.name: Ricardo Ariel Augusto

texts.es:
Ariel con un gran espíritu trabajador y aventurero, se dedica a la cría de peces desde hace 2 años con una meta fija que es la de poder salir adelante y poder construir junto a su familia un buen futuro.
Trabaja todos los días en su negocio durante jornadas de 10 horas en busca de una buena producción y venta.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de alevinos, alimento para los mismos y adecuaciones a su estanque.

Estos elementos le permitirán trabajar más efectivamente y tendrá una mejor producción.

Ayuda a un humilde pescador de las tierras colombianas con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Ariel, with a hardworking and adventurous spirit, has made his living raising fish for two years. His permanent goal is to be able to move forward and to build a good future together with his family. 

Ariel works 10 hours every day in his business, in hopes of good production and sales. He asks for a loan to buy small fish, fish food, and improvements for his pond. These things will allow him to work more efficiently and to have better products. 

Help out this humble fisherman from the lands of Colombia with a loan!

loans.use: to buy small fish, fish food, and improvements to his pond.

loans.name: Katerine Dayana

texts.es:
En la cría de aves encuentran muchas personas una gran oportunidad de vida y desarrollo, tal es el caso de Katerine que con sus 20 años tiene un pequeño negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde, los cuales alimenta para venderlos posteriormente.

Vive en el municipio de Corozal donde comparte su vida con su esposo.
Son una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora y sincera.
En los ojos de esta campesina se refleja el esfuerzo y la dedicación.

Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de gallinas, pollos y alimento para los mismo, de este forma lograra aumentar su producción y mejorar su capital de trabajo para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Many people find a great opportunity for life and development in raising chickens; this is the case for Katerine, who at age 20 has a small business of caring for laying hens and for chickens to fatten, feeding them for later sale.

Katerine lives in the town of Corozal, sharing her life with her spouse.  They are a poor family, but very hardworking and genuine.  Effort and dedication are reflected in the eyes of this woman of the countryside.  

She is seeking financial support to buy hens, chicks and feed for the same; in this way she will succeed in increasing her production and her working capital to be able to offer better financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy hens, chicks, and food for them, and thus increase  production

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en: Enkhtaivan, 40 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2010. Before this business, he has been working as a security officer at a private firm. His wife makes and sells handmade clothes to local people. The house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Alen

texts.en:
Alen is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two school-aged daughters in Kapan city of Syunik region. Alen’s wife works at the supermarket as a saleswoman. Alen now works simultaneously in two places: at the city rescue service and as a locksmith for the city. 

Alen mentions that when their daughters were smaller they usually managed to save some money, but now that they are getting older it has become impossible to save money because there are now more needs. The flat where they live needs to be repaired, but the lack of money has prevented them from doing that for several years. With this loan, Alen wants to repair parts of his flat. With 500,000 AMD Alen wants to start repairing his bathroom.

loans.use: to start repairing his bathroom

loans.name: Osiris Yolanda

texts.es:
Osiris, radicada zona rural del municipio de Sincelejo, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva 20 años con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que adquirirá varios Porcinos y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos.

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus hijos a quiénes desea ofrecerles lo mejor.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Osiris, living in a rural area of the municipality of Sincelejo, has always worked in the agricultural field with her family members, who taught her the necessary skills.

She has been caring for and fattening pigs for sale and distribution in several areas of her town for twenty years.

Osiris dreams of increasing the number of pigs she raises and has asked the Corporación Interactuar for an loan with which she will buy several pigs and the raw materials to feed and sustain them.

Increasing the number of animals will provide her much larger earnings, permitting a better quality of life without as much financial difficulty.

Osiris' children depend on her business, and she wants to offer them the best in life.

loans.use: to aquire several pigs and the raw materials to feed and sustain them.

loans.name: Nadin Jose

texts.es:
En su trabajo como criador de cerdos de levante, Nadin ha intentado encontrar el sustento diario para su familia, es padre de una hija de cuatro años por la cual lucha incansablemente para darle todo lo que necesita.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como alimento y materiales para la adecuación de su cochera; este préstamo será importante para él, pues de esta forma tendrá sus animales en mejores condiciones y podrá ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, facilitando también su trabajo.
texts.en:
Nadin has been trying to support his family by raising pigs. He has a 4-year-old daughter for whom he works tirelessly.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as food and materials to improve his barn. This loan is very important to him, as it will allow him to have his animals in better conditions. The loan will make his job easier and he hopes to be able to sell his pigs at a better price.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as food and materials to improve his barn.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is live in Oecusse and she is a business women. She has a small store and she is very high interest in doing business.  She has been involved in business activities since 2011 with her own working capital of $200.00, and she make the best on it. 

She is earning a good income from her business, so with this loan she wants to improve her management for her business and she is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store including wheat, aqua, slippers, toothpaste, sugar, noodles, shampoo, milk, Including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy flour, aqua, slippers, toothpaste, sugar, noodles, shampoo, milk, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Melsiana

texts.en: Melsiana has been involved in business activities since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $100. Melsiana is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is selling gasoline because she earns a good income from this business and she lives near the main road and every day many people come to buy her gasoline so she is still happy to do her business.  When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, she said with this loan she will improve the management of her business to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.en:
Doña Teresita is 51 years old and lives with her husband in Bello, where she has run a stall selling typical Colombian food for the past 6 years. 

She would like to take out a loan of $2,500,000 in order to purchase a fryer and change the tyres on the churros car. She hopes that this can help increase production and consequently her income. 

Doña Teresita dreams that her hard work will one day pay off and she will be able to buy a new home in which she can live happily with her husband.  Your help can make this possible!

loans.use: to purchase a fryer and change the tyres on the churros car

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, brass, polish and beads, as well as improvements to his workshop.

Victor has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I was unable to study beyond elementary school due to financial difficulties. I joined my brother-in-law, who was a master carver specializing in traditional African objects. Since 1999, I've worked independently with ten experienced carvers. We use a hardwood known as sese for carving our masks. We use sandpaper and polish to achieve a smooth object of good quality. I use paint, metal plates and sometimes clay to decorate and preserve our works."

"I say thank you to everyone who is helping me with this loan, for being there for me in my time of need."

Use the link below to view Victor's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/3571">http://www.novica.com/kiva/3571

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, brass, polish and beads, as well as improvements to his workshop

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old, married and has one child to provide for. She wants to help her husband who is a fish vendor for a living. She has been engaged in a sari sari store business to earn a living for six years already. It was a successful business for the family because they get their daily needs from this business. Gina aims to increase her income so she decided to borrowed a loan to buy more good items to sell in her store so that she can increase her store inventory and be able to generate more income.

Gina's plan for the future is to expand her business from her business income.

loans.use: to buy more good items to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is the mother of two children and is the age of 48. She wants to help her husband who is a security guard in providing her children's needs and other needs for the family. That's why she has a vegetable garden. She plants vegetables and sell them to the market to earn a living. She aims for a better income so she decided to purchase fertilizer for the vegetable garden to be able to produce a good quality of vegetables. Then she can sell more vegetables in the market and she can gain a better profit.

Emma's plan for the future is to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Theodosia

texts.en: Theodosia is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is married and her husband is a mechanic. She is doing this business because she earns a good income and every day many people come to fix their bikes in the garage so she is still happy to do her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy some tools such as  plugs, carbide welding, gas rope, tools and other motor spare parts. Theodosia has been involved in business activities since 2013 when she started with her own working capital of $200.

loans.use: to buy plugs, carbide welding, gas rope, tools and other motor spare parts.

loans.name: Felisberta

texts.en: Felisberta has been involved in business activities since 2010, having started with her own working capital of $200. She is highly interesting in doing business, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital. She will buy additional supplies such as soy sauce, sardines, candles, biscuits, detergents, rice, noodles and other items to sell. This loan will help her to open a bigger kiosk in the future.

loans.use: To buy soy sauce, sardines, candles, biscuits, detergents, rice, noodles and other items to sell.

loans.name: Annabelleyet

texts.en:
Annabelleyet, 38 years old, is married and has two children. She is engaged in corn production and also helps her husband as a chainsaw operator. Annabelleyet aims to increase her income and therefore decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for the corn farm. This will help her farm produce a good harvest to result in a good income.

Annabelleyet's plan for the future is to save money from her business income to sustain her children's educational needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the corn farm.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa, from the city of Samana, is taking a housing loan. This is her sixth loan, which she will use to improve her house. She sells clothes in her neighborhood and this is her main incoming activity. Her latest loan was invested in the business.

Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown faithfulness in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as they are running their businesses and attending their group meetings.

Santa wants to finish building her house. With this loan, she will buy cement, rods, concrete blocks and other building material to change her zinc roof for a concrete one, and also her wooden walls for concrete blocks. She wishes to have a safe and nice home to share with her family. Thanks to God's will, she will be able to take a closer step to finish building her home, and she can save more from her business profits. She has three children and they live together with her long-term partner. She thanks God, Esperanza International, and all of you for this opportunity. Thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, concrete blocks, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 53 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 8 years, she has run a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines. She  also earns an income from pig fattening and a repair shop.

Elizabeth has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan through NWTF to further build her businesses. She will use her PHP 28,000 loan to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell. Elizabeth has previously borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF. Elizabeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Lea works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Lea is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like netting, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like netting, gasoline, wood, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, 35 years old, is married and has three children. She is engaged in banana production and sells the bananas to the market. In this way, she is able to help her husband, who is a welder in a shop, in providing for her family's needs. Rosemarie wants to increase her income so that she can provide for her children's needs and wants. She borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm to produce a good quality of bananas so that she can deliver plenty of bananas to generate more income.

Rosemarie's plan for the future is to buy a new vehicle to use in the delivery of the bananas to the market.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married and she is a businesswoman. She has a very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2013 with her own working capital of $500, and she did her best with it. She is earning good money but she still wants to improve her management for her business, so she is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more additional items to keep in her store including rice, wheat, cooking oils, milk, aqua, noodles, cigarettes, hand and body lotion, and other things to sell including soft drinks. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.
