loans.use: to buy rice, wheat, cooking oils, milk, aqua, noodles, cigarettes, hand and body lotion, and other things to sell including soft drinks.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: A $1,500 loan is offered to Filomena to repair her house. She started construction of her house but was not able to finish because of lack of money to buy materials. Filomena is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy materials such as cement, stone, sand, etc. to help her finish off her house.

loans.use: To buy cement, stone, sand,and other materials

loans.name: Rawda

texts.en: Rawda is a 35-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children who are attending school. She is a housewife and her husband works very hard as an employee in a local company to help the family live in good conditions. Today, given that her children will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation and help them become able to get good jobs that will give them a good income.

loans.use: to register her children at school

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 45-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and one child. Her husband is the main income provider, and as for her, she doesn’t work; she cares only for home and family. Today, in order to pay her child's school fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a permanent customer and she insists that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her child.

loans.use: to pay her child's school fees

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store. These include noodles, cooking oils, water, slippers, soap, candy, lighters and other items to sell. Marciana has been doing business since 2010 with her own working capital of $250. She is taking this loan to improve her management of the business because she wants to open a big store in the future. Marciana is happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin offered to her.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cooking oils, water, slippers, soap, candy, lighters and other items to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice and other items

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 36-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father for one son and one daughter. Wisam works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. During the last violence on Gaza, most of Wisam's house was destroyed. This happened to most of the houses in his neighborhood.

Wisam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to rebuild his destroyed house. By taking this loan, Wisam will be able to buy some construction materials so he can fix his house and live in it again. Wisam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his destroyed house

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a single woman who has no  children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Juana, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada, tiene 3 hijos y vive junto a su pareja y dos hijos porque uno que se encuentra en otro país y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.    

Juana, tiene una tienda desde hace más de 7 años, decidió emprender este negocio por iniciativa propia, para ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar; después de ver que no había una tienda cerca de la zona, decidió emprender el negocio, en el cual le ayudan sus hijos.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar más productos para su tienda, porque con el tiempo va ganando más clientes y quiere atenderlos de la mejor manera, para que su negocio siga creciendo.  

Juana, quiere que su negocio siga creciendo y que sus clientes estén contentos y satisfechos con el servicio que les brinda.
texts.en:
Juana, 45 years old, is a very hard-working person; she finished fifth grade. She is in a relationship. has three children and lives with her partner and two children, since one of her childen lives in another country.  Her partner works in agriculture.  

Juana has had her own store for more than 7 years; she decided to begin this business on her own initiative, to help her partner support the household.  After noticing that there was no store near her area, she decided to begin the business, in which her children help.  The loan she is seeking is to buy more products for her store, because over time she has been adding customers and wants to assist them in the best way, so that her business will keep growing.  Juana wants her business to continue to grow, and her customers to be happy and satisfied with the service that she offers them.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Nunung

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Nunung, one of Ruma's agents. Nunung lives in Cianjur, located in West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her children (one daughter and one son). Nunung owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories to her community. 

As the business grows, Nunung needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Your loan will help Nunung's community to get a better access to communication service, as well as helping Nunung to improve her business.

Nunung’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.  Later on, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Nunung is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her village community.

loans.name: Danis Maria

texts.en:
Danis is 32 years old and lives in the town of Monteria, situated in the region of Cordoba. For the past 10 years she has run her own store in order to help support her two young boys aged 3 and 8, respectively.

She never takes a day off, but the lack of stock in her store makes it difficult to reach a satisfactory level of sales.  For this reason she is looking to take out a loan of $2,500,000 COP so she can expand her inventory, and buy products such as cold meats as well as new shopping baskets for her customers. 

Danis dreams of improving the home that she lives in, and hopes that she can one day provide a brighter future for her two sons.

loans.use: buy products such as cold meats as well as new shopping baskets

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian trabaja y al mismo tiempo estudia, es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser un profesional exitoso que ayude a las demás personas.
Quiere salir adelante como persona y profesional y es por eso que pone todo de sí para poder lograr su meta.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Cristhian works and is also studying at the same time. He is the type of person who strives to become a successful professional so that he can help other people. Cristhian wants to move forward as a person and as professional. For this reason, he is doing everything he can so that he can achieve his goal.

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay the fees for his degree. This will allow him to continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Jasca

texts.en:
Jasca is a smallholder farmer from Kapsowar area of Kenya. She practices dairy farming: Her major source of income is milk. Throughout the years, she has experienced challenges finding capital required to fence her farm. She has been making use of locally available materials to create structures similar to fences, but that has not been very effective. 

Jasca is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 to build a proper fence. Having a good fence will not only be useful to her in terms of controlling animals' movement but also bringing a sense of security in her farmland. Income generated from milk sales will be used to service the loan by Jasca.

loans.use: to buy fencing materials

loans.name: Yulieth Paola

texts.en:
Yulieth is 27 years old and lives with her husband and one year old daughter in the town of Cerete, situated in the region of Cordoba. She runs an information centre which also provides Internet service to her local customers.

She would like to take out a loan of $1,2000,000 COP so that she can buy a glass cabinet, lots of paper for printing and telephones for her clients to use. She hopes that providing a varied service will allow her to become more competitive in the local market and create sustainability for the foreseeable future.

Yulieth one day dreams of buying her own home where she can live happily with her newborn daughter and husband. This is why she works so diligently every day for eight hours, so that she can be proud of her business and provide her daughter with a bright future.

loans.use: buy a glass cabinet, lots of paper for printing and telephones for her clients to use

loans.name: Yolanda Maria

texts.en:
Yolanda is 46 years old and lives in La Estrella, situated in Itagüí, just south of Medellín.   She runs her own store, which was passed on to her by her father, and has been doing so since 2005, so as to provide for her 8 year-old son.

She would like to use this loan to buy more stock, especially liquor, which she hopes will increase her sales production and be popular during national festivals.

Yolanda is driven to give the best possible opportunities to her son, and hopes that he can one day become the next owner of the store, providing she can use this loan as a means to provide long-term sustainability and financial success.

loans.use: to buy more stock, especially liquor

loans.name: Enma Liliam

texts.es:
Enma tiene 54 años de edad, sus padres no tenían suficientes condiciones económicas para mandarla a estudiar, está casada y su pareja es empleado de una institución, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos viven en casa.

Enma se dedica a la elaboración de tamales de pollo y cerdo, esto lo aprendió de su madre, ahora Enma elabora hasta 500 tamales de encargo y también sale a vender al mercado, por lo tanto debe levantarse a las 3:00 de la mañana y prepararse para trabajar.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar carne de pollo, carne de cerdo, maíz, aceite, etc para elaborar tamales y el resto para lo usará como complemento para comprar un vehículo para salir a vender el producto.

Enma siempre ha soñado con vivir bien, que sus hijos sigan adelante y sobre todo que Dios los proteja y siempre seguir trabajando con esta institución.
texts.en:
Enma is 54 years old.  Her parents couldn't afford to send her to school.  She is married and her husband works for an agency.  She has three children, two still living at home.

Enma works at making chicken and pork tamales; she learned this work from her mother.  Enma now makes up to 500 tamales on order, and also goes out to sell at the market, so she must get up at 3AM and get ready to work. She is asking for this loan to buy chicken, pork, corn, oil, etc., to make tamales, and will use the rest for a complementary purpose, to buy a vehicle to go out and sell her product.

Enma has always dreamed of living well, that her children would get ahead in life and above all that God would protect them. She wants to always   continue working with this organization.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork, pork, etc., in order to make tamales, and also, complementarily,  to buy a vehicle with which to go out selling her product

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en:
Ramel, 43, lives at Intramuros, Manila. He is a very diligent and hardworking father and husband. He is married to Nemia, and they are blessed with two kids.

Today, Ramel would like to borrow a loan that he will use in establishing and developing his current business, a small sari-sari (variety) store. He would just like to add more grocery items to display and sell because it will mean a lot in his income profit. Since his wife is also just a vendor, he would like to improve his sales so that they can ably supply the basic needs of their household. And, if there's an opportunity, they would like to save for their future, especially for their children's education.

He just needs PHP 30,000, and he is truly hopeful that you will be generous enough to help him with this.

What he prays for every time is to always have strength and good health.

He meets up every week with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add more grocery items to display and sell.

loans.name: Nonsaart Group

texts.en: Kheum’s village obtains much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink, without treatment by boiling.  Kheum and his group are excited that the filter has been made available on a payment plan, which makes it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he will be able to shift to other pursuits.  Kheum and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years.  Within these two years filter users, like Kheum’s family, see a substantial decrease in illnesses and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter, so they can have safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 37 years old, married, and has two children to provide for. She has been engaged in banana production to earn a living for six years, already. It really helps her meet her family's needs. She aims for a better income, so she decided to avail a loan to pay for labor for harvesting the bananas. This will enable her to harvest plenty of bananas and deliver plenty of bananas to the market, and that will generate more income.

Jessa's plan for the future is to buy a vehicle to use in delivery of the bananas to the market.

loans.use: to pay for labor for harvesting the bananas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, an associate from the city of Samana, is taking a housing loan. Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled their commitment to grow their businesses, and who have shown faithfulness in their groups. This program allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their houses, at the same time that they are running their businesses and attending their group meetings.

Maria wants to finish building her house. With this loan, she will buy wood, concrete block, zinc for the roof, and other building materials. She wishes to have a safe and nice home for her older years together with her husband, and to run her business from there.

This is Maria's 15th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has a home decor business, where she sells curtains and other products to decorate houses. Her latest loan was invested in the business. She has been taking loans from Esperanza International since almost eight years ago. She thanks God, Esperanza International, and all of you for this opportunity. On behalf of her and her family, thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy wood, concrete block, zinc, and other building materials.

loans.name: Carmelo Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, a sus 34 años de edad es padre de tres hijos. Desde que era muy joven conoce la labor de la cría y comercialización de cerdos, actividad que realiza en la finca donde reside, así complementa sus ingresos, mientras que utiliza el espacio que tiene disponible en su finca. 

Los cerdos son vendidos luego de ser engordados, ya sea vivos o por kilos, dependiendo de los requerimientos que haga el cliente. 

Con el ánimo de aumentar su capital de trabajo y su producción, solicita el crédito para comprar lechones para engorde, que le permitan tener disponibilidad suficiente. 

Manuel desea hacer de su negocio una actividad rentable, donde pueda tener una producción escalonada que le genere ingresos constantes y así mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 34 year old father of three children. Ever since he was very young, he has worked raising and selling pigs, a trade that he does on the farm where he lives. This supplements his income, while using the space that he has available on the farm.

The pigs are sold after being fattened, either alive or by the kilo, depending on the customer's requirements.

With the desire to increase his working capital and production, he requests a loan to buy piglets for fattening, in order to have sufficient supply.

Manuel wishes to make his business a profitable one, where he is able to have staggered production that will generate consistent income and thus improve his family's living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy piglets for fattening, in order to have sufficient supply.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia is applying for a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin, to improve her business. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including eggs, noodles, detergents, cigarettes, coffee, shampoo, and other things to sell. She started her business in 2013 with working capital of $200. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, noodles, detergents, cigarettes, coffee, shampoo, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 44 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.

Apoya con un préstamo a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Pedro is a 44 year-old man who works as a farmer and is a loving father.  Seeing that his income was not sufficient to cover the household expenses, he started a business raising and selling pigs in order to improve the living conditions of his family.  As he is responsible for all of the expenses of the household, he has not been left with enough capital to invest in his business.

This is why Pedro needs a loan to buy pigs to fatten and pig feed.  With this investment, he will be able to increase his sales and boost his business, as   he will have more assets in his small business.  This will make it more attractive from the view of his customers, as he will have more pigs to offer for sale.

Pedro's main dream is to generate a good income so that his family does not have to do without, as this is something he has experienced in life and it affected him greatly.  This is why he works tirelessly for his children and his wife.

Support this loan to a farmer from the Colombian countryside who has great dreams for his family!

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 54 years old, married, and has one child to provide for. To earn her living, she makes fish crackers and sells them to the market. As a mother, she wants to give what is the best for her child. Therefore, she decided to borrow a loan to buy more ingredients for fish cracker-making, so that she can produce more fish crackers to sell in the market and gain more income from it.

Rubie's plan for the future is to save money from her business, and use it to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for fish cracker-making.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Thanks for your unwavering support to Anita. Because of the loan that you granted her recently, she was able to accomplish buying more merchandise products for her sari-sari (variety store). This has indeed aided her in meeting the household's basic expenses, and helped in attracting more customers as well.

To continue what she has started, she would like to avail another 40,000 loan. She would use it to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell for her business. Your small act of generosity now can be a good head start for Anita's dream of expanding her business and providing a better life for her family.

She meets every week with her co-fellowship members,* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell for her business.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur. She has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

She is now borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs.

Eda dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. For three years now, she has been managing her own sari-sari store. She does this together with her husband, Juan Miguel, who is a construction worker. Their summed up income helps them to survive every day’s needs and expenses.

Having faithfully paid back her previous loan, which amounted to PHP 10,000, she would respectfully like to avail another loan worth PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items, like shampoo, biscuits, condiments, and other related products. Surely, this will help her improve her profit at no given time. She sincerely lets you know her gratitude for your deep-rooted generosity and kindness.

Mary Jane dreams of being successful someday, with the current inventory. By then, she will be able to earn for her children’s education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, like shampoo, biscuits, condiments, and other related products.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur, who has three children.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF, in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like fish vending.

Isabelita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Gniguiya N°I Group

texts.fr: Sur la photo, Martha est la femme qui tient le bélier. Elle a 45 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui sont âgés de 11 à 32 ans, parmi eux il y a 4 écoliers. Elle fait l’élevage ovin, son mari fait le gardiennage. Martha fait recourt au prêt pour acheter plus de moutons pour son élevage enfin de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices. Elle exerce ce travail depuis 10 ans. Martha est alphabétisé, c’est pour cela elle se soucie de la  scolarisation de ses enfants. Le prêt lui aide à subvenir à ses charges familiales ainsi que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants  grâce aux bénéfices générés. Elle s’approvisionne au marché et ses ventes se font en détail au marché de sa localité en espèce. Elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000 CFA après ses dépenses. Les obstacles auxquels se heurte Martha est que souvent l'aliment bétail devient un peu chère au marché.
texts.en:
On the photo, Martha is the one holding a sheep. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of six children ranging from 11 to 32 years of age. Four of her children attend school. Martha raises sheep, and her husband grows vegetables. Martha is applying for a loan to buy more sheep and increase her revenues. She has been doing this work for 10 years. 

Martha is able to read and write, which is why she is concerned with her children's schooling. The loan will allow her to cover family expenses as well as school fees for her children thanks to the revenues generated. Martha makes her purchases at the market and retails also at the local market, for cash. After her expenses, her monthly revenue is 10,000 West African francs (CFA). Among her challenges, Martha names high prices for animal fodder at the market.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Valentena

texts.en:
Valentena is 65 years old and married. To earn her living and be able to help her husband, a fisherman, she engages in fish vending. She aims to increase her income, to better meet the daily needs of her husband and herself. She borrowed a loan to buy materials for fishing boat repair, so that her husband can catch more fish and she can sell more fish in the market and gain more income.

Valentena's plan for the future is to buy a new fishing boat, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing boat repair.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Cecille works hard to support her family. She has a personal products sales business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from fish vending and a general store.

Cecille is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She is using the loan to buy additional perfume, body lotion, and ready-to-wear clothing to offer for sale.

Cecille has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional perfume, body lotion and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 56 years old, married, and has eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell. Shirly has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and she earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Shirly aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 54 years old, married, and has four children to provide for. He is engaged in a piggery business, to earn income. As the father of the family, he wants to give his family a good life. To achieve this, he must increase his income. So he borrowed a loan to buy feed for his pigs, so that he can produce a good quality of meat from his pigs and sell it in the market, to generate more income.

Daniel's plan for the future is to expand his business, to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
It was Fe's privilege to be helped by KIVA find individuals that helped her with a previous loan of PHP 10,000. She used this to buy equipment, supplies, and materials needed for her tire repair shop. Because of that, there was great improvement in her business, improving her income. 

Fe comes to you again to request PHP 15,000 to further improve her inventory, buying more accessories needed for repairing tires. 

Someday, she wants to be successful in her business and then build a life that is more affordable for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more accessories needed for repairing tires

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Anafe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen food and a general store. Anafe is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Anafe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 50 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Brigida works very hard to provide for them.

Brigida has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Brigida has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, personal care products and school supplies. 

In the future Brigida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and is running a mini shop that helps generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeve, short sleeve, shoe. She opened her mini shop a year ago with her own working capital of $ 200.Antonia is a hard working woman. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as bags, toys, clothes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $100. She is a hard working woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy bags, toys and clothes for sale

loans.name: Augusto Rafael

texts.es:
Augusto con 52 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 4 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace 20, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comercialización de cerdos, pues los compra, los cría, engorda y posteriormente los vende según el peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito con la Corporación Interactuar, para invertirlo en la compra de alimento para darle a su animales, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

Mejora la vida de este colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Augusto is 52 years old. He lives in a domestic partnership and is the father of four children. Throughout his adult life he has run a variety of businesses, through which he has earned income to sustain his family. When he was 20 years old he began raising hogs. He purchases them, raises them, fattens them and then sells them when they gain enough wait. This enables him to earn enough money to continue caring for and sustaining his family.
Augusto is a hardworking man, motivated by his family, he is thriving and taking great pains each day to get ahead. This motivated him to request the loan through Corporación Interactuar which he will invest in the purchase of feed for his animals. This will ensure that he has enough of them to fill the orders he has, and to increase his profit margin and earnings. 
Help improve the life of a Colombian man through this loan!

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals.

loans.name: Cristian Jose

texts.es:
Cristian, a sus 35 años de edad vive en unión libre y es padre de 2 hijos. Es agricultor, ganadero y porcicultor; posee una finca donde tiene varias hectáreas de cultivos con productos como yuca y plátano, cuyas cosechas son comercializadas en el mercado de la región y así obtiene el dinero necesario para sacar adelante su gran familia. 

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, activo y pujante, esto le ha dado fuerzas para salir siempre adelante, sobrepasando los diversos obstáculos que se le presentan. 

Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de cerdos para la cria, alimento, materiales para construcción de cochera e insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, venenos, entre otros con lo que podrá obtener el sustento diario para sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Cristian, who is 35 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and is the father of 2 children. He is a farmer, rancher, and raises hogs. He has a plantation where he has several hectares of plants, with products like yucca and plantains. The harvests are sold at the regional market, which is how he gets the money he needs to support his big family.

He is known for being a hard-working, active, and thriving man. This has given him the strength to always keep moving forward, overcoming the various obstacles that come up.

He is requesting the loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of pigs to raise, animal feed, materials to build a garage, and farming supplies like manure, fertilizer, pesticide, etc. With this he will be able to obtain daily support for his children and wife.

loans.use:
to buy pigs to raise, animal feed, materials to build a garage, and farming supplies like manure, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.

 materiales para construcción de cochera e insumos agrícolas como abonos, fertilizantes, venenos, entre otros

loans.name: Maritza Rosibel

texts.es:
Maritza, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, tiene dos hijos, ella se creció en una zona rural, depende de padres que se dedicaron a la agricultura y la ganadería, con principios cristianos y sobre todo muy trabajadores. 

Maritza, se dedica a hacer panes para vender, todo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, pero además de eso siempre cultiva granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia. 

El dinero del crédito lo invertirá para comprar una novilla y para compra abono para la milpa. 

Maritza, sueña con viajar a los Estados Unidos y trabajar para poder colocar un negocio al regresar acá y así ya no tener desintegrada a la familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 22 years old. She studied through high school. She is married with two children. Maritza grew up in a rural area where her parents were farmers and cattle ranchers. Their household was Christian and hardworking. Maritza makes breads which she sells to help her husband cover household expenses. In addition to this she raises basic grains to feed her family. She will use the loan to purchase a heifer and to purchase fertilizer for her land. 
Maritza dreams of traveling to the United States and of working to establish an business when she returns home so that her family won't be separated.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer and fertilizer for the field.

loans.name: Giovani

texts.en:
Originally from Brazil, Giovani and his wife saw a great opportunity to move their steel foundation work to Massachusetts 15 years ago. They love the work they do, the work environment they've created and that together they run their business to support their son. 

Their business, Strong Arm Iron Workers, is a member of one of the largest international trade association unions. Through their business they work to reinforce steel and also participate in several underwater projects. 

Giovani is dedicated to always expanding and improving his business. In the construction industry clients typically pay for projects on a 15–30 day schedule. However, Giovani's employees expect to earn pay every seven days. As a result, Giovani is working to meet his business's cash flow needs in order to be able to take care of his workers and pay them on a weekly basis. 

His next step is to go back to school and earn a bachelor's degree in business administration.

loans.use: to provide a  weekly payroll for employees of his construction business

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a 28-year-old farmer who lives in a rural community in one of the poorest states of Mexico. With a previous loan from Kiva, Sergio developed a sustainable cattle-raising ranch through a silvopasture system for breeding and fattening steers. 

He is asking for a second loan to buy a small irrigation system in order to produce more grass for his cows. 

His goal is to save money, increase his production and sell cattle to other farmers in the area, fostering economic activity in the community. Sergio has been working with an NGO to obtain the technical expertise and has built the necessary infrastructure to develop the silvopasture system. 

This project will improve the living conditions of his family and will contribute to the conservation of a high environmental value area.

loans.use: to buy a small irrigation system to increase grass production for his cows

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jose es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de distribución de mercancía

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerá su esposa a la cual desea darle todo lo mejor.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar un vehículo.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un veterano lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Jose is a very enterprising and creative man. For a long time he has wanted to be independent and have his own goods distribution business. Now he is able to realise his dream thanks to his great capacity for work, the support he is getting from Corporación Interactuar and from the people who want him to make progress with his business. His wife, whom he wants to give everything of the best, will be dependent on this business.

Jose is asking for a loan to buy a vehicle. With a loan you'll be able to help an older person who is full of life and drive for his family!

loans.use: have financial support to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
This is Celestina, age 46, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Despite her age, she’s still buckling down and doing everything she can to help her husband, Leopoldo, in providing for the family despite the breadline. She has been operating a piggery for years now and she really longs to improve this because of her two children.

Yours now is the chance to help as Celestina lets you know her sincerest request. She would like to acquire financial assistance of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which she’ll use to purchase more pigs for her agriculture business. With sound mind and clear hope, she dreams for her family to succeed someday and make a go of her business. And this dream starts now, with you.

Celestina meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 43 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old and married with three children. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Petrina

texts.en:
Petrina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Petrina is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Petrina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Petrina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Petrina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luisa Maria

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de campo, siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y progresar con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos cerdos para cría y cuido.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Luisa is a hard-working country woman. She has always had the strength to get on in life and make progress with her family. For some time she has wanted to set up a business raising and selling pigs. This is why she is asking for major financial support to buy some pigs to raise and look after. 

With this new business she will be able to generate an income for her family which means everything to her and she will be able to improve her husband's and children's quality of life. She will work every day to drive her business forward and make it sustainable and profitable.

Help a hard-working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to have major financial support to buy some pigs to raise.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 37 years old, and all four children are sent to school.

Jocelyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nohemi

texts.es:
María de 26 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja reside en Estados Unidos, tiene un hijo pequeño que está a cargo de ella.

María desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a vender lotería nacional, el negocio lo inició debido a que quería obtener más ingresos, empezó con un puesto de ventas ahora tiene varios puestos en muchos lugares, el horario es de 8:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

María utilizará el préstamo para comprar más billetes de lotería y otro puesto de ventas.

María sueña con que su hijo crezca sano y continúe sus estudios.
texts.en:
María, who is 26 years old, studied as far as her high school diploma. She has a partner and he lives in the United States. They have a small son who she takes responsibility for. For several years María has made a living selling lottery tickets. She started this business because she wanted to have more income. She started out with a sales stand and now she has several stands in lots of places. Her working hours are from 8am to 4pm.

María will use the loan to buy more lottery tickets and another sales stand. María's dream is that her son grows up healthy and continues with his education.

loans.use: to buy more lottery tickets and another sales stand.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis, un campesino lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere sacar adelante a su familia con el sudor de su frente. 

Por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en el municipio de San Pedro de Los Milagros, donde no solo destaca el precio si no también la calidad de los cerdos que allí se crían. 

Luis solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos, alimento, medicamentos para los mismos y materiales para adecuación de cocheras, con el único objetivo de progresar y cuidar de su familia que es la que eleva su espíritu luchador y pujante. 

Trabaja arduamente todos los días durante 7 horas en distintas actividades, es un hombre rebuscador e inquieto
texts.en:
Luis, a man of the country, full of dreams and aspirations in life, wants to support his family with the sweat of his brow. Therefore, he started his pig rearing business, a common profession in San Pedro de Los Milagros municipality, where not only the price but also the quality of the pigs raised there stand out.

Luis requests a loan in order to buy pigs, food and medicines for them, and materials to make into pens. With his sole objective to take care of his family and help them get ahead, which is what elevates his fighting and thriving spirit.

He works hard every day for 7 hours in various trades. He is a resourceful and restless man.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food and medicines for them, and materials to make into pens.

loans.name: Uyel

texts.en:
Uyel is 37 years old and married with two children. Both of whom are in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Uyel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Uyel has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future, Uyel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leoneda

texts.en:
Leoneda is 44 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leoneda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leoneda has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Sari-sari stores are seen everywhere in the Philippines. Sari-sari means "variety". Since then, they provide the people with products mostly needed for everyday survival - from products for personal hygiene such as shampoo, toothpaste, and powder to condiments, food, canned goods and other stuffs at a low cost. This is why many of those who want to go into business often start by being a sari-sari vendor because with just a small capital, you can automatically operate a store and earn.

It's just like Salve, 55 years old, from Pasay City, Metro Manila. She began being involved in this kind of business five years ago. And through all those years, she was able to provide her children a living through the income she gets from the store. What she does is basically buy stuffs in a large quantity and then display them at her store and sell them at retail, often at a price that is very affordable for people but is larger than the original price so she can have a profit.

However, you cannot expect a regular and stable income from this since sales vary from time to time. For this reason, Salve wants to ask you for a PHP 15,000 loan that she will use to buy more supplies of products to display in her store. Certainly, this will really help her improve her business and attract more customers.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of products to display in her store.

loans.name: Miguel Mariano

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Miguel desea iniciar un negocio de cría y levante de cerdos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con sus hijos y esposa.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños y en materiales para construcción de una cochera.
texts.en:
With a great deal of drive and perseverance, Miguel wants to set up a business raising and looking after pigs at his home, which is situated in the municipality of Tierra Alta. This idea has arisen from the need to generate a decent income to contribute to the upkeep of his home where he lives with his wife and children.

He is known as a hard-working and very co-operative man and these qualities mean he has earned the respect of the people in the village.

With this loan he will be able to get this business started. The money will be used to buy small pigs and materials for building a pig shed.

loans.use: to buy small pigs and materials to build a pig shed.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina wants to repair her house, but now her money is not enough to buy all the material. Agripina is requesting a loan of $1500,00 from Tuba Rai Metin so that she can buy more materials such as sand, stone, wood, cement, nails, zinc, iron, and other materials to use.

She is very happy because she can get a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. With this loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can complete her house.

loans.use: to buy zinc, sand, stone, iron, cement, and other materials to use for repairing her house.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old, is married, and has two children. To earn a living and be able to help her husband as a motorcycle driver, she is engaged in a flower garden.

Jessica plants flowers and sells them to the neighborhood and also in the market. She aims to increase her income for sustainability of their family needs, so she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer for the flower plants so that she can produce plenty of beautiful flowers to sell that will generate more income.

Jessica's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her flower plants.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Emily has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda has been involved in business activities since 2014 when she started with her own working capital of $400. She has a kiosk in front of her house and she is taking a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies including cigarettes, biscuits, cooking oil, milk, ketchup, sauces, noodles, sweets, pens, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She was very happy when Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, because she can use this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, biscuits, cooking oil, milk, ketchup, sauces, noodles, sweets, pens, soft drinks,  hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Thank you lenders! You are such a great help to Ofelia. What you have lent her recently was able to help her in providing for the daily expenses of her household and developing her business (sari-sari store).

As her business expands, she would like to take out another loan worth PHP 20,000. She will use this to buy additional products to sell like grocery stuffs and similar products. You have once proved to her that God has been faithful in her life. She believes that you will help her again this time.

Someday, she hopes for a better life for her children and to give them a better education. She prays that they'll get a bigger house one day and that her business will grow more and expand.

Ofelia meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell like grocery stuffs and other similar products.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 49 years old and single. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jessica has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jessica has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Marco Xavier

texts.es:
Marco es un joven Ecuatoriano, nació en Tanicuchí una zona Rural de  la ciudad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi, vive en un sector rural de la ciudad de Latacunga en casa de sus Padres, donde se caracteriza por su clima frio y la población se dedica a la crianza de animales. Marco tiene 20 años de edad y es soltero. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres estudió hasta la secundaria. Se dedica a la elaboración de recuerdos para todo compromiso social trabajando más de 8 horas diarias.  
Marco usará el crédito solicitado para la compra de material, ya que tiene pendiente algunos pedidos. Con este crédito espera mejorar sus ingresos. Marco agradece a Kiva y Fundación Alternativa por ayudarle a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marco is a young Ecuadorian. He was born in Tanicuchí, a rural area of the city of Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi. He lives in his parents' house in a rural district of the city of Latacunga, which is known for its cold climate. The locals make a living from raising animals. 

Marco is 20 years old and is single. Thanks to his parents' hard work he studied as far as secondary school. He earns a living making souvenirs for all kinds of social gatherings and works more than 8 hours a day. Marco will use the requested loan to buy materials, since he has some outstanding orders. With this loan he hopes to improve his income.

Marco is grateful to Kiva and Fundación Alternativa for helping him to realise his dreams.

loans.use: to buy materials for making souvenirs, to have an income to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Rudita

texts.en:
Rudita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an Avon dealership business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of Avon products to offer for sale.

Rudita has been in this business for three years. Rudita earns more income from pig fattening.

Rudita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Yily Catherine

texts.es:
Yily es una mujer con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta de productos de uso personal
Es una mujer muy aplicada pues tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de este tipo de productos como lociones, cremas, entre otros.

Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de una mujer emprendedora Colombiana!
texts.en:
Yily is a woman with all the energy and willingness necessary to confront and overcome the world. She wants to launch a business selling personal products. She is a very applied woman because she has a desire to get ahead and be a professional.

She requests a loan in order to be able to purchase such products as lotions and creams, among others.

With this loan she is able to fulfill her dream of being independent, as well as being able to pay for her studies and get ahead thanks to the support of Kiva and the Interactuar Corporation.

Support the project of a Colombian female entrepreneur!

loans.use: to purchase such products as lotions and creams, among others.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old and married with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development.

She practices vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure to enable her to increase her vegetable production. This will increase production, hence earning more income to pay for her children's education, food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure for increased vegetable production, hence earning more income to pay for her children's education, food and clothing.

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es:
Carla, de 30 años de edad, está acompañada, estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre de dos hijos varones y su pareja se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas. 

Carla, tiene un cafetín en la escuela de su comunidad desde hace más de 10 años.

El préstamo lo necesita para surtir el cafetín con más producto. 

Ella sueña con hacerle arreglos a su casa, ya que le faltan varias cosas para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Carla is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She studied up to high school and has two sons. Her partner works in agriculture. 

Carla has had a small cafe at the school in her community for over 10 years.

She needs this loan to stock her cafe with more product. She dreams of making repairs to her house because several things need to be repaired in order for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to stock her small cafe with more product.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is living in a mountainous village with her family. She is married and has four children. She has had a business in agriculture for about 20 years. She plants cereal and potatoes. She is willing to process and well dig her land for the next season. She hopes to gain a good harvest and profit to help her husband to ensure their family. She is asking for financial support from KIva and IMON to buy fertilizer. She awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, una madre de 30 años de edad con 1 hijo a su cuidado, es madre cabeza de hogar ya que su esposo falleció hace algún tiempo y ha podido sostener a su familia gracias a que trabaja en múltiples actividades.

Solicita un crédito para reiniciar su propio negocio, una pequeña de pollos los cuales criara y alimentara para posteriormente venderlos, la iniciativa la tomo básicamente por su hijo, ya quiere disfrutar con el de una mejor vida, que estudie y que todos los días tenga un motivo para sonreír. 

Apoya a esta empresaria que quiere demostrar que el papel de madre y padre no le queda pequeño solo necesita tu voto de confianza
texts.en:
Marina is a 30-year-old mother with one son in her care. She is mother and head of the household as her husband died some time ago. She has been able to support her family thanks to the fact that she works in various occupations.

She is requesting a loan to restart her own business, a small chicken farm; she will raise the chickens, feed them and subsequently sell them. She essentially took the initiative because of her son, as she wants to enjoy a better life with him; she wants him to study and have a reason to smile everyday. 

Support this business owner, who wants to show that the role of mother and father isn't too much for her; she just needs your vote of confidence.

loans.use: to restart her own business, a small chicken farm

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has five members including her husband, her three children (two daughters and one son) and her. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation, so the income after deducting all costs is just about VND 40 to 50 million. However, the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses. She wants to invest in buying nitrate to fertilize the corn and sugar cane but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan will help her family have good conditions to tend the corn field and the sugar cane field, so the coming harvest will bring her family a yield half as much again as last year. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy nitrate fertilizer

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa, 53, is a married woman with eight children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Luisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luisa has been in this business for three years.

Luisa requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

In the future, Luisa would like to save money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Hoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurt, a farmer living in Sangke district of Battambang province, is a mother of six children, five of whom are dependent on her. Four of her children are in school. 

For a living, she is growing rice and cucumber and raising pigs as the main sources of income. She has been in these businesses for ten years. 

She has to spend about 41,900 KHR per day in family expenses. Her difficulty is that her harvests do not produce enough crops to resell. 

This is the second cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and the past loan helped her to have a better living condition. Now, she leads a three-member group to get a new loan and she will use her portion to buy crop seeds, pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can expand her business to earn more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy crop seeds, pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Tuoi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuoi, 57 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and a child of her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding and the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She intends to expand the breeding model by raising pigs, which can produce super lean meat, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to expand the breeding model by raising pigs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel has been involved in opening a furniture shop since 2010. She started her business with her own working capital. Isabel is married, and she is a businesswoman.  Isabel has a kiosk in her house. So she is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional materials, including sugar, biscuits, milk, nuts, shampoo, aqua, detergents, cooking oil, hard drinks and other things to sell. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy sugar, biscuits, milk, nuts, shampoo, aqua, detergents, cooking oils, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a hardworking entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a fish-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Judy dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothing. 

Fe is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 58 years old, married and has four children. 

Cecilia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cecilia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Hom's Group

texts.en:
Hom, born in 1968, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January, 1995. She lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding, and the income is just enough to cover living expenses. Because her son is still of school age,  she has to pay much for his education, and her income is not enough for her to pay. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to pay the education fee of her son and invest more in his education. 

She will find an extra job to work to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her son have better conditions for studying.

loans.use: to pay the education fee of her son.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is an honest woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1986. She is married and has three children. She is living with her family in a mountainous district with hospitable residents.  

She is a farmer. She has land where she plants agricultural products. At the same time, she keeps livestock. Doing business in the agricultural sector helps her to earn money for living. 

She wants to enlarge and develop her business in the future. She needs to buy construction supplies to construct a shed for livestock. She appealed to Kiva to get a loan to buy construction supplies and construct a shed. She is willing to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and construct a shed for livestock.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, ella realiza oficios domésticos, producción de granos básicos y comercialización de lácteos, está acompañada, tiene 4 hijos y vive con su pareja y dos de sus hijos. 

Martha, se dedica al comercio y producción de granos básicos, dichas actividades las realiza desde hace varios años, esto siempre con el apoyo de su pareja, para el sustento de su familia y el desarrollo económico. 

Martha, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para la producción de granos básicos y alimento para el ganado.

Martha, sueña con que sus hijos concluyan sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and studied up to ninth grade. She tends to her home, produces basic grains and sells dairy products. She has a partner and four children; she lives with her partner and two of her children.

Martha makes a living producing and selling basic grains. She has been doing this for some years, always with her partner's support, to support her family and develop economically. 

Martha needs a loan to buy fertilizers, to produce bulk grains, and livestock feed.

Martha dreams of her children finishing their studies and becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to produce bulk grains, and livestock feed.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has three children. 

She has an activity in agriculture of planting cereal and potatoes and keeping livestock. She really takes care about her planting and wants to gain a good harvest in the coming season. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy fertilizer and forage for her livestock. She hopes her business will succeed and she can earn money to feed her family. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and forage for her livestock.

loans.name: Hoan's Group

texts.en:
Hoan, 47 years old, is an ethnic Thai woman. She currently lives with her husband, her son and her daughter-in-law, and a child of her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
 
Her family’s main income is from cultivation. Her family has 1.2 hectares of cultivated land for coffee, and the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and save a small amount. 

She wants to buy fertilizer for the coffee, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
	
She hopes that the loan amount will help her family tend the coffee field well, and then in this year of harvesting of coffee, it will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosalie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Alba Jeannette

texts.es: Alba tiene 45 años de edad,  es madre soltera y vive junto a sus de dos hijos de 14 y 8 años de edad. Alba es una mujer emprendedora que realiza la labor de oficios varios y gracias a ello le permite hacer todo lo que este dentro de sus posibilidades para dar a su familia todo lo necesario en el hogar.  Alba anteriormente con el deseo de mojorar su vivienda  solicito un crédito  para compra de pintura que utilizo para las paredes de su casa ademas reparo vidrios de las ventanas solaires que se encontraban en mal estado, con la intencion de mejorar vada vez mas su humilde hogar vuelve a solicitar un nuevo credito  a FUSAI que le permita invertir en lámina galvanizada, clavos y polines para reparacion del techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Alba is 45 years old, a single mother and lives with her two children of 14 and 8 years old. Alba is an enterprising woman who does several jobs and, thanks to this, she is able to do everything in her power to give her family what they need at home. 

Alba previously requested a loan with the desire to improve her home. She used it to buy paint, to paint the walls of her house, and also repaired the window panes which were in poor condition. With the intention of further improving her humble home, she is once again requesting a loan through FUSAI, which will allow her to invest in galvanized sheet, nails and poles to repair the roof of her home, which is in poor condition.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet, nails and poles to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Icela Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ícela, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, no tiene hijos y vive únicamente con su esposo, el cual trabaja como distribuidor de gas y agua.

Ícela, tiene un negocio de venta de agua desde hace un año, fue su esposo quien la motivo a colocar este negocio, además de eso tiene una tienda; ella junto a su esposo salen a vender todos los días desde las 7:00 a.m. en un vehículo.

Ícela, necesita el crédito para surtir la tienda con jugos, gaseosas y gelatinas, ya que con más diversidad de productos tendrá más ventas y mayores ingresos.

Ícela, sueña con tener una tienda en la cual pueda vender de todo tipo de productos y también sueña con algún día ser madre.
texts.en:
Ícela, who is 20 years old, studied until ninth grade, is married, does not have any children and lives with only her husband, who works delivering water and gas.

Ícela has owned a business selling water for a year, it was her husband who encouraged her to start this business, as well as that she has a shop; she, together with her husband, goes out in the vehicle every morning at 7am to sell.

Ícela needs a loan to stock her business with juices, sodas and jellies, because with greater product diversity she will make more sales and earn more money.

Ícela dreams of having a shop where she can sell all kinds of products and also dreams of being a mother one day.

loans.use: to stock her business with juices, sodas and jellies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a shoe sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Vilma is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of footwear to sell to customers.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of footwear to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita built her house, but she does not have enough money to buy more materials so she can complete her house. Therefore, she requested a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more materials such as sand, cement, stone, wood, iron and other materials to use. She is very happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin offered to her. She was eager to build up her home and with this loan she can be completing her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stone, wood, iron and other materials to use.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children. She is 47 years old and one of her children is in school.

Jane is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Jane has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fátima Nohemy

texts.es:
