Charlene requested a PHP 60,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Charlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy trabajador y con un gran corazón campesino que ha sido fortalecido con la humildad y la sensatez que distingue a los habitantes del municipio de Montería.

Vive en una finca con su esposa, quien han sido su más grande apoyo y maestros de la vida. Aprendió de de la agricultura a través de su padre y  empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas de plátano, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Juan sueña con tener una mejor vivienda en un futuro y tener un negocio que sea sostenible.
 ¡Impacte la vida de Juan y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Juan is a very hard-working man with a big, farmer's heart which has been strengthened by the humility and good judgement which distinguishes the residents of the Monteria municipality. 

He lives on a farm with his wife who has been the biggest support in his life. He learnt about agriculture from his farther, by means of experience and observing other people. 

He is thinking of using his loan to purchase agriculture and farming supplies such as banana plant seeds, pest controls, and supplies to carry out maintenance on his crops.

Thanks to this loan, the economic situation and quality of life of his family would improve, and he would be able to increase his income. 

Juan dreams of having a better home in the future and of having a sustainable business. 

Help improve the life of Juan and his family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agriculture and livestock supplies such as banana seeds, pest controls, and supplies to carry out maintenance on his crops

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with one school-going child. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a khanga (women's wrap cloth) business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Milly Elizabeth

texts.en:
Milly Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Milly Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Milly Elizabeth has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Berta to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like petrol and diesel. Berta is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy petrol and diesel

loans.name: Juan Timoteo

texts.es: JUAN TIMOTEO: Es un señor sonriente de 31 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita de la comunidad de Kamla, que se localiza a 15 kilómetros de la Ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casado con 2 hijos: El mayor de 9 años de edad estudia su segundo año de primaria y una pequeña de año y medio. Su esposa es ama de casa. Él trabaja como jardinero en una de las universidades del municipio. Desde hace 9 años habita en una casa de tambo y madera, con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y digna, está solicitando su primer financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda (Concreto y madera), comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos, zinc, cemento, hierro, bloques. Él y su esposa sueñan con tener una vivienda bonita.
texts.en:
Juan Timoteo is a smiling 31 year old man.  He is of the Miskita ethnicity.  He is from the Kamla community, which is 15 kilometers from the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas community.  He is married and has two children.  The oldest is nine years old and in the second year of elementary school.  The other is a little one and a half year old.  His wife is a housewife.  He works as a gardener for one of the municipal universities.

He has lived in a stilt and wood home for nine years.  In order to provide his family with a more safe and decent house he is requesting his first loan in order to start building his house with heavy bases (concrete and wood).  He will buy building materials like wood, nails, corrugated zinc sheeting, cement, iron, and cement blocks.

He and his wife dream of having a nice house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like wood, nails, corrugated zinc sheeting, cement, iron, and cement blocks in order to build a sturdier house.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as social. 

He operates a retail business where he sells rice, soap, bread, cooking oil, flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with good business and his primary customers are locals. He says his biggest business challenge is price fluctuations. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, cooking oil, flour, sugar, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. 

He will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, cooking oil, flour, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, soap, bread, cooking oil, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, cooking oil, flour, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a cafe.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, cooking oil, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor, tiene 56 años se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 3. 

Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

El y su familia viven en zona rural de Los Córdobas en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos de plátano.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

¡Impacte la vida de Victor y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Victor is 56 years old and has earned a living from agriculture for 3 years.

He learnt about this business empirically, that is to say by means of experience and observing other people. 

He and his family live in a rural zone in Los Cordobas, in which it is not easy to access financial services such as those offered by the Interactuar Corporation.

He is planning to use his loan to purchase agricultural and farming supplies such as seeds, pest controls and fertilizers to carry out maintenance on his banana crops. 

Thanks to this loan, his economic situation and the quality of life of his family would improve and he would be able to increase his earnings. 

Help improve the life of Victor and his family with a loan!

loans.use: to buy agricultural and farming supplies such as seeds, pest controls and fertilizers to caryr out maintenance on his banana crops.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 33 years old and has six children. Rodelyn is married, and five of her children are currently in school.

Rodelyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rodelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rodelyn has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rodelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is 47 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lisa is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lisa has been in the pig-fattening for five years and also earns income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
This loan of $1,000 will allow Jose to send his daughter to university school. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies. 

Jose loves his daughter very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies

loans.name: Voeun's Group

texts.en:
Voeun is 56 years old and she lives in the Bakan district of Pursat province. She is a married woman who has ten children, six of whom are dependent on her. Three of her children are in still in school. 

In order to support her family, Voeun grows rice as her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages and she can earn about 25,000 KHR per day; she manages to save about 18,500 KHR each day. 

Now, she has insufficient capital to support her business so she is leading a three-member group to get a new loan. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loans already and this will be her fourth. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living conditions, making them much better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Berna

texts.es: BERNA: Es una señora amable de 40 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos: adolescentes que estudian su carrera universitaria y secundaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como pescador artesanal. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 23 años vende pepinos de mar a una empresa de Bilwi que los procesa y exporta. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos a los buzos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
Berna is a kind, 40 year old woman.  She is married and has six children.  They are adolescents who attend the university and high school.  Her husband works informally as a fisherman.

In order to contribute to the household expenses and her children’s education, for 23 years she has been selling sea cucumbers to a company that processes and exports them.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products from the divers.

She dreams of being a successful merchant.

loans.use: to buy sea cucumbers.

loans.name: Lizeth Andrea

texts.es:
LIZETH cuenta con una experiencia de varios años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 10 años. 
Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller desea generar empleo para personas con muchas necesidades. 

Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en buenos pedidos. 

Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, LIZETH requiere de un préstamo para 
Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos
texts.en:
Lizeth has many years of experience in the sewing business. She has had a sewing workshop for third parties in her house for ten years. She works all day long and with her workshop she wants to generate employment for people in need. 

She learned this business from her mother who taught her since she was little. The advantage is that she already has recognition in the industry and the quality of her products is very good, which has allowed her to continue to get more clients for her business and to receive good orders.

Given that her current production capacity isn't sufficient to satisfy all of her clients, Lizeth needs a loan. 

Her greatest desire is to advance her sewing workshop business and to be able to have better economic opportunities in her home in order to thrive with her husband and two children.

loans.use: to purchase a tabletop sewing machine and sewing materials and thus increase the production capacity of her business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, fish, biscuits, slippers, body lotion  and soap. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 400 USD. Josefa is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock to keep in her store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Emma has been in this business for 29 years now.

Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en: A resident living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Phen is 45 and a married mother of two dependent children. To make a living, she grows cassava as the main source of income. Phen also grows paddy rice to supplement her family’s income. She has been involved in her business for 27 years. As she has to support her family’s needs, she can manage to save only 15,600 KHR per day from her low income. Currently, there are pests seriously destroying her cash crop so that she cannot harvest good outputs to sell. Willing to provide her family members with healthy lives, Phen is leading a two-member group to take out a loan and this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s Partner). She will spend her loan building a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that her family members will live healthily and safe from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: This woman lives in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. Her name is Larisa. She is a widow and she lives with her two sons. Both her sons are already grown up and they greatly help their mother for their family needs and particularly they help Larisa with their farming and agricultural activities. On her farm Larisa takes care of cows, calves, bulls and sheep. With the help of her smaller son Larisa sells her farm’s meat, milk and some small assortment of dairy products. Larisa also cultivates on her plot of land potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes. These vegetables she sells to re-sellers right from her farm. Larisa has an idea to enlarge her farm and with her Kiva loan she wants to buy two calves and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Glenis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Glenis, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Tierra Alta, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante.
Trabaja todos los días durante 14 horas con 2 empleados.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Glenis ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas, sillas y mesas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Straightforward and hardworking, Glenis is a feisty woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to looking after her children. She lives in the municipality of Tierra Alta where she earns her living preparing and selling meals such as breakfasts and lunches in a small restaurant. She works 14 hours a day and has two assistants. 

Glenis has decided to improve her business and increase sales so she is looking for a loan to buy ingredients for her recipes, as well as chairs and tables. This loan will allow her to grow her business which in turn will lead to the opportunity to continue supporting her family.

Please support this woman and help her realize her dreams!

loans.use: buy ingredients and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Luis Gonzaga

texts.es:
Luis es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.

El tiene un cultivo de plátano y yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Montería.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás agricultores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción. 

El solicita el crédito para comprar una canoa e insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas de plátano y pesticidas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara sus cosechas de una manera significativa enfrentando la dificultad más grande que tiene que son el clima tan cambiante que afecta su cosecha.

 Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores del Colombia como lo hace la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante sus tierras con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Luis is a seasoned farmer with extensive experience working in the field. He is a humble, unassuming man, he has great people skills and the energy to bring any cultivation to a productive harvest. He has a plantation of bananas and yucca where he works every day, and he sell the harvests in the Montería marketplace.

Thanks to his father's guidance since childhood and his years of experience, he is fully able to do field work and to advise other farmers in the area who need assistance with their production.

He is applying for this loan to buy a canoe as well as agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, banana seeds and pesticides. He will in this way add capital to his business, and significantly improve his harvests by facing the greatest difficulty: the constantly changing climate conditions affecting the harvest.

Luis has much faith in his business and hope in the solidarity of people that support working farmers in Colombia, as does the Interactuar Corporation.

With your loan, you will assist a humble farmer to carry out his work.

loans.use: to buy a canoe as well as agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, banana seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en: Berta has one idea for requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin because Berta has plans to repair her house. She wants to buy materials to repair her house but her money is not enough to buy all the material, so she is taking this loan to buy more materials like cement, ceramic cement, ceramics, and other materials to use so that she can complete her house with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy cement, ceramic cement, ceramics,  and other materials to use.

loans.name: Victor Arley

texts.es:
Victor es de la ciudad de Medellín, se dedica al comercio hace 2 meses, es soltera, y con la ayuda de su madre se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya es muy conocido en el sector donde ubica su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, y con ello puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. 

Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y tener una vida llena de éxitos y triunfos.

Pide este préstamo para la compra de surtido de jeans, camisetas y calzado para abastecer su inventario, de manera a que pueda mejorar sus ingresos por medio de su trabajo y puede ir aumentando su negocio de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Victor is from the city of Medellín. For the past two months he has been working in commerce. He is single and with the help of his mother he has opened a new door and today is well-known in the area where he has his business.

He works selling clothing and doing so he has the means to be able to help his family. He is a very hard-working person and a fighter who wants to get ahead and have a life full of success and triumphs.

He is requesting this loan to buy a variety of jeans, t-shirts and footwear to stock his inventory. Doing this he can improve his income through his work and can continue to expand his business in the best manner.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jeans, t-shirts and footwear to stock his inventory.

loans.name: Wynie

texts.en:
Louie Jay is 17 years old and is the second of the two children in the family. His mother Wynie, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Louie Jay is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in secondary education and is currently in the second year of this four-year course.

Wynie is borrowing PHP 4,670 to pay the tuition fees of her son Louie Jay for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Louie Jay plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Tatiana Maria

texts.es:
Tatiana es una responsable, respetuosa, trabajadora, honrada y honesta mujer que da su vida por apoyar incondicionalmente a su hijo, que es todo para ella y gracias a él siempre tiene una sonrisa para atender sus clientes cada que van a comprar algún producto en su negocio. 

Tatiana tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de la canasta familiar y su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa propia para vivir junto con su hijo y pareja. 

Gracias al crédito podrá invertir en compra de surtido en grano, carnes, dulces, snacks, víveres. Y su mayor beneficio es diversificar la oferta de productos a los clientes.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a responsible, respectable, hardworking, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her son who means everything to her. It is thanks to him that she has a smile for her customers when they come to her store to buy some product or other. She runs a small grocery store; her dream is to improve her home where she lives with her son and partner.

With the help of a loan Tatiana will be able to buy more stock such as grains, meat, candy, snacks, and other goods. Then she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

loans.use: buy more stock such as grains, meat, candy and snacks

loans.name: Luz Celis

texts.es:
Luz, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para sus dos hijos (Ver Foto), inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Apartado, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de planchas para el cabello, secadores y esmaltes de uñas de diferentes colores, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio y podrá mantener a flote su servicio.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Luz a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en:
Luz, in her constant search for a better life and greater economic stability for her two children, started a manicure and hair styling business. She goes to her clients homes in the municipality of Apartado where drive and determination are very important for the people who live there.

She works every day at different times and is always busy due to being in high demand because of the quality of her work.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy hair straighteners, hair dryers and different colours of nail polish.  This will enable her to continue her business and provide a better service.    

These days she feels happy because of the good job she has done until now and because it has allowed her to enjoy more stable employment. 

With a loan she will be able to continue her life project.

loans.use: to buy hair straighteners, hair dryers and different colours of nail polish.  This will enable her to continue her business and provide a better service.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Nasceu em buzi província de Sofala tem 41 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 5 filhos menores de idade que frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua sogra e seu tio que vive em sua casa.  
Começou a trabalhar com a hluvuku em 2014, este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku, com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: tijoleira e azulejos para sua casa. 
Futuramente pretende realizar o matrimónio e adquirir uma viatura e construir um estabelecimento comercial.
O seu maior desafio manter o seu negócio sustentavel
texts.en:
Luis was born in Buzi in the province of Sofala and is 41 years old. He is in a common-law relationship and has five young children, all of whom are in school. He is also financially responsible for his mother-in-law and for his uncle, both of whom live with him.

Luis began working with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner] in 2014 and this is his third loan with them. He will use this loan to buy construction materials like paving stones and tiles for his house.

In the future, Luis would like to formalize his marriage, buy a car, and build a commercial establishment. His biggest current challenge is keeping his business profitable.

loans.use: buy tiles and paving stones for his house

loans.name: Chamberlene

texts.en:
Chamberlene is 36 years old and married with four children.

Chamberlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, bread, eggs, etc. to sell.

Chamberlene has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Chamberlene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, bread, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Evangeline has been in pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Evangeline is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Martik

texts.en:
Martik is 37 years old and he lives in Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. Martik lives here with his two sons and his parents. Martik usually does different construction work but farming and agriculture are the main source of income for his family. He has a small farm where he takes care of cows, a calf, a heifer, pigs and piglets and also a lot of chickens. With the help of his mother, Martik sells a great range of farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy product), cheese, butter, meat (beef, pork and poultry) and eggs. Martik also cultivates some vegetables on his plot of land (potato, tomato, cucumber and greens), part of which Martik sells and the other part he uses for his family.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Martik asks for as he wants to enlarge the number of farm cattle and wants to buy one more and also some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also some fodder for his cattle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sagiko, beer, water, body lotion and fish. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sagiko, beer, water, body lotion and fish.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Magret is 43 years old and she supports three children. She has been a farmer for the last four years and the business earns her KES 17,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus produce to clients in the market.

She plans to use the gained profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate her children.

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops for a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus produce to clients in the market.

loans.name: Niforlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Niforlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of bananas business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Niforlyn is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Niforlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Khley's Group

texts.en: A farmer living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Khley is 34 years old and the mother of three dependent children who are still in school. For a living, she grows cassava as the main source of income and grows paddy rice to supplement income. She has been in these businesses for 16 years and she can earn only about 28,900 KHR per day to support her family. Having been destroyed by pests, the crop cannot produce better outputs for her to resell at a good price in the market. This is the fifth time for Khley with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan successfully. The previous loans helped her to have enough household supplies to use. Now, she is leading a group of two to get a new loan to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to provide her family members with healthy living and to decrease the expenses on health care services.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina started her business in 2010 with her own working capital of $1,000. She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough working capital to buy needed items according to what people need. After that, she got the information about Tuba Rai Metin. She came to get the information, and she is very interested in it.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more needed items to keep in her store such as soap, detergents, cigarettes, aqua, sugar, sardines, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

She has been busy with her business, and she is happy to do that. She wants to make her kiosk bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergents, cigarettes, aqua, sugar, sardines, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sokha is a married mother of two dependent children. Those two children are too young to attend school. She sells grocery items and fishes in inland water for the main sources of income. In order to supplement her family income, she also grows paddy rice. She has been involved in these businesses for two years.

She is facing a financial management problem now; some people owe her some money, so that she cannot make better support for her family members on time.

This is Sokha’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Leading a group of four members to get a loan, Sokha will use it to buy fishing net and a boat to support her business. She hopes to earn more income from her business to renovate her house and to support her children’s studies until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a boat to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and staying together with her husband and one child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Artavazd

texts.en: Artavazd is 49 years old and he lives with his wife and his daughter in Ddmashen village of the Gegharkunik region. His son is passing his military service in the army now. Artavazd has higher education with the specialty of accountant. Since never managing to work in his specialty, Artavazd established a farm and today he cares for it very very much. Here he has cows, a heifer, a calf, sheep and chickens. In addition to all these farm products Artavazd also manages to sell his land’s potatoes and beans. This farmer hopes now to have more income from his farming which will be possible if he manages to enlarge the number of his cattle. Artavazd is asking for this loan as he decided to buy two more cows and also he will buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more cows and also he will buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Paskaliah

texts.en:
Paskaliah is aged 50 years and supports six children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last five years, and the business earns her KES 8,500 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow, so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily and meet needs of clients who have increased in the region, and the demand for milk.

She plans to use the gained profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate her children. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily, and meet needs of clients who have increased in the region, and the demand for milk.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a single man. He describes himself to be a risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are individuals.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, oil, fish, slippers, water, soap, and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $500.  

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, oil, fish, slippers, water, soap, and biscuits

loans.name: Tatul

texts.en:
In the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region lives Tatul with his wife and two sons. Tatul is a farmer who works a lot and overcomes any hardships just to develop his business and have more income for his family. On his farm, he takes care of cows, calves, pigs, sheep and chickens. Tatul’s wife makes very tasty cheese and butter. Along with his farm's milk, meat and eggs, he also sells cheese and butter to his regular customers from his village and from the city as well. Tatul also has a not small vegetable garden; he cultivates potatoes, beans, cabbage, greens, tomatoes, cucumber, carrot and garlic. These vegetables he sells at the city wholesale market.

This loan Tatul needs for developing his vegetable production, particularly potato products. With this loan, he will buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 13 years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Rehema dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kes 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: A resident living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Chanthou is a 34-year-old farmer. She is a married mother of three dependent children who are still in school. For a living, she grows cassava to earn the main source of her income. Growing rice is a supplemental business for her family’s income. She has been involved in these businesses for 46 years. Chanthou’s current challenge is the pests that destroy her cash crops so that they cannot produce good output for her to resell. This will be the second loan for Chanthou from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of four members to apply for a new loan. As a representative, she will spend her loan on building a decent latrine for her family members. She hopes that this loan will enable her family to live healthy lives and protect them from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family members.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a resident of Muniguda village in Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 35 years old. She has a small family including her husband and only one daughter. She and her husband are engaged in the occupation of seasonal seeds business. No doubt she has everything required for the basic necessities of life, a two wheeler and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are bothered about completing their own house.

At present, they are staying in a rented house with a high rate of rent charged by the house owner. The rented house is made of mud and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during the rainy season. It is also very critical when staying during the winter period. The most important thing is the apprehensive house is not completely secure and safe.

In this situation, Swapna decided to construct an RCC house with good standards. Although she has some savings for the house construction, it is not sufficient to complete it. So she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institutions. Swapna came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation decided to disburse a loan for her house construction.

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few days and she will be proud to be a house owner in society.

loans.use: to construct her own house.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Albertina to improve her business. She is married, and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, water, fish, body lotion, eggs, and biscuits.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Albertina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family.

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, water, fish, body lotion, eggs, and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily and meet the needs of clients who have increased in the region and demand milk.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
O senhor Sergio de 33 anos de idade é comerciante e segurança, casado e pai de 02 filhos 01 menor  sustenta a sua mãe e irmao que vivem com ele na casa própria .
Diz que com valor do credito irá aplicar na compra de mercadoria  como, cervejas, refrigerante, vinhos , açucar , massas, sabao para melhorar o negocio na sua barraca. 
Diz que os planos para o futuro sao muitos, mais tem como prióridade fazer o muro de vedação do seu quintal, ampliar a sua casa e crescer no seu negocio .
Principais desafios insuficiência de fundos e elevado custo de vida, faz xitique para para melhorar a situação financeira , com os creditos anteriores conseguiu fazer a casa onde vive e a barraca na sua casa .
texts.en:
Sergio is 33 years old and works both as a security guard and running his own business. He is married and has two children, and he also helps to support his mother and a brother, both of whom live with him.

With this loan, Sergio will buy merchandise such as soft drinks, beer, wine, sugar, pasta, and soap in order to increase business at his sales stand. He has many plans for the future but the main ones are to build a wall around his property for privacy, to expand his house, and to grow his business.

Sergio's main challenges have been a lack of funds for his projects and the high cost of living. He has used the traditional Mozambican communal loan system called xitique to help his family's financial situation, and with previous loans he was able to build the house where he now lives and also his sales stand.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, beer, wine, sugar, pasta, and soap.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean, 51, lives in Kampong Thom Province of Cambodia. She is a mother of five children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for almost thirty years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.50 per day, on average.

To assist her farming process, she would like to have a cart to carry many heavy farming materials from her house to the rice field, but she can’t afford it. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a cart to use in her farming process. This loan will help to make her farming operation less difficult.

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a cart

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 59 years old. She lives in Gonio with her pensioner husband and son. Liana has a newly opened bakery, where she bakes Georgian "khachapuri" (cheese pie) and has a good number of satisfied clients.

Liana needs additional money and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan for purchasing stock of cheese and flour. Liana will be able to produce more product and increase the turnover, and thus increase the income of her family. Liana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cheese and flour for her newly opened bakery.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Angelina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Angelina has been raising livestock for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 50 years old and she lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law in Varser village in Gegharkunik region. For several years, Susanna used to work as a tailor, but for many years she has been a farmer and in that activity, her husband and son greatly help her. On her farm, she has cows, calves, a heifer, bulls, sheep, lambs and chickens. As she mentions, none of her family members has constant work, which is why farming is the main family activity. Land cultivation also brings income and provides her family with fresh and tasty vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber, garlic, onion, beans, peppers and greens. All her farm products Susanna sells locally to her regular customers and to re-sellers. This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams she needs for the purchase of potato seedlings and diesel fuel and she also needs to buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings and diesel fuel and buy fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers buy. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anela

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Anela to improve her business. Anela opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own money. She will use the loan to buy stocks of items to keep in her store like noodles, sagiko, water, biscuits, coffee, and sugar. Anela is generating a good income from selling items at her kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing this business. Anela is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sagiko, water, biscuits, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Rasmita

texts.en:
Rasmita is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 31 years old. She has a small family: her husband and only one son. She and her husband are engaged with the occupation of a seasonal and transport business. No doubt she has everything as per requirements of the basic necessities of life, like two sources of income, a two-wheeler, a good RCC shop, and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not happy due to no availability of a good RCC house that they own.

At present, Rasmita and her family are staying at a rented house with a high rate of rent. Rasmita thought that paying loan installments is better than to give a high rate of house rent. So, she and her husband decided to build their own RCC house with all possible facilities. The main concern for Rasmita is scarcity of funds. So, she decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution.

At this moment, Rasmita came to Mahashakti Foundation to learn about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation decided to disburse a loan for house construction. She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few days, and she will be proud to be a house owner in the society.

loans.use: to construct her own house.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 70 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a buying and selling of livestock business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresiah is aged 36 years, and she supports two children. She has been a dairy farmer for the last five years, and the business earns her KES 8,500 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to clients daily and meet the needs of clients who have increased in the region and demand milk. 

She plans to use the gained profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to clients daily and meet needs of clients who have increased in the region and demand milk.

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en:
Olandina was married and her husband is a mechanic. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

Olandina has been involved in business activities since 2010; she started with her own working capital of $1,000.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy some tools such as oil, tires, gears, and other things to sell. She is doing this business because she is earning a good income from this business, and every day many people come to fix their bikes in the garage, so she is still happy to do her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, tires, gears, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 49 years old and married with six children.

Brenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Brenda has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from food vending.

Brenda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años cuando su cosecha esta lista la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gatos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas entre otros así como muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con sus siembra y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face is blurred, is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk zone and has made a living for the past five years farming. When his harvest is ready, he sells it in the surrounding towns – and what he obtains through sales he uses to resolve the cats around his home. 

The young man lives in his own home with his partner and their son. He is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer, pest control and other items – and as the photograph shows to be able to continue farming and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 34 years old and married. She has three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. She has been in pig fattening for three years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 54 years old. She has a small family: her husband and three children. She and her husband are engaged with the occupation of a betel shop, cable connection and a CD/DVD business. She has everything as per required of the basic necessities of life: an owned house, income from different sources, a bike, a three wheeler, a good shop and other allied items to manage her family. 

One of her sons' marriage is going to be held after three months. As the house is small, there is not sufficient room to maintain all three sons’ accommodation. The house is very congested to stay in. It became very difficult to live in such a small house with relatives during social functions. The most important thing is that after marriage, the couple wants some privacy, which is not possible in Parbati’s house. 

In this situation, she decided to construct at least two rooms at the first floor. The main constraint is unavailability of sufficient funds, so she decided to borrow a loan from a bank or other financial institution. At this moment, Parabati came to Mahashakti Foundation to know about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation decided to disburse a loan for first floor house construction. 

Parbati is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few days and her children will stay happily.

loans.use: to construct her own house

loans.name: Kimthach's Group

texts.en:
Kimthach is a resident living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 34 years old, and she is a married mother of three children, two of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she is growing paddy rice as the main source of income. In order to supplement the income, she also works as a paid worker. She has been involved in this business for 16 years.

Currently, the crops are destroyed severely by insects. She also has insufficient capital to support her business. Therefore, she decided to form a group of two, to get a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the first loan cycle for her. As a group representative, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to increase the production of crops and earn more income, to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at her home, to improve her family's access to sanitation and water.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra, a 36-year-old married mother of two, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been buying and selling livestock in the Philippines for five years. 

Alejandra has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, quiere montar un negocio de transporte de personas.

Ella vive en el municipio de Santa Fe De Antioquia en compañía de sus hijos que son su más grande motivación.

Con la ayuda de un crédito podrá materializar este sueño, pues podría comprar una motocicleta.
De este negocio dependerán sus dos hijos.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una madre lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Maribel is a very entrepreneurial, creative woman and wants to start a personal transportation business. She lives in the city of Santa Fe de Antioquia with her two sons who are her biggest motivation. 
 
With the help of a loan, she will be able to make this dream a reality as she will be able to purchase a motorcycle. Her two sons will depend upon this business.  

With a loan, you will be able to support a mother full of life and energy for her family!

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle – a business her children will depend on.

loans.name: Büşra

texts.en:
Büşra is married and has a child. For six months she has been selling Tupperware products. She started this activity to make a contribution to the family budget. She is planning to buy products on promotion and sell them, with the help of the loan. She aims to move upwards in this business and become a group leader.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:
Büşra hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Altı aydır bir arkadaşının tavsiyesi ile Tupperware ürün satışı yapıyor. Ek gelir elde etmek ve aile bütçesine katkı sağlamak için bu işe başlamış. Aldığı kredi ile promosyonlu ürünler alıp satacak. Böylece kar oranı artacak. Hedefi bu iş de ilerlemek ve grup lideri olabilmek.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products.

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.en: Since 2010, Vitoria has been operating a small kiosk in her house selling a variety of items, a business she started with her own working capital of $1000.00. Because she would like to enlarge her enterprise, she is requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to sell  including slippers, sugar, shampoo, eggs, candy, cooking oils, soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: To buy slippers, sugar, shampoo, eggs, candy, cooking oils, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Yeun's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Yeun is 54 years old. She is a married mother of five children, two of whom are dependent on her. She struggles for a living via growing rice as the main source of income. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in these businesses for 36 years, and she can make a little income, which is about 36,100 KHR per day, to support her family. 

While not being able to give family better support, the crop products are also sold at a low price in market. This leads her to save less money for her future. 

Now, she is leading a group of two members to get a new loan, and it will be her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to buy rice seeds, pesticide and fertilizer for her cash crops. She hopefully wants to earn more income to buy household supplies and other agricultural tools to support her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, pesticide and fertilizer for her cash crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is aged 37 years, married to Daniel, and supports five children. She has been a farmer for the last five years, and the business earns her KES 15,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops on her farm for a better harvest for family use and for sale of the surplus to clients in the market.

She plans to use the gained profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, to educate her children and also provide for them better medication. Her hope is to improve her living standards and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops on her farm for a better harvest for family use and for sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is 46 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Severina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, diapers, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Severina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase locksmith tools, rechargeable drills, fittings and stock of locks, as well as to develop his website and do some advertising.

loans.name: Ralisatou Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA est responsable du groupe  RALISATOU. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Madame fait le commerce de vêtements pour enfants (layette, slips) depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter une douzaine de layettes et 30 douzaines de slips pour enfants.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne exceller dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. RASMATA is the leader for group RALISATOU. She is married and a mother of three. Her oldest is eleven years old and her youngest is two. Two of the children got to school; she has three dependents.

She has retailed children’s clothes (baby linens, underwear) for four years. She procures her merchandise from nearby markets.

With the loan granted, she plans on purchasing a dozen sets of baby clothes and thirty dozen pairs of children underwear.

She wants to use profits made through the loan to reinvest in her business. She ambitions to excel in her business.

loans.use: to buy a dozen sets of baby clothes and about thirty dozen pairs of children underwear.

loans.name: Mildred Gisleny

texts.es:
Mildre es una mujer emprendedora de 41 años de edad, madre de dos hijos y es casada. 

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; por ello se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una maquina fileteadora, recubridora y una maquina plana.  

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado. 

Con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo siempre de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar
texts.en:
Mildred is an enterprising 41 year old married mother of two children. During her working life she has worked in different sewing workshops which is why she has experience and knowledge in running this type of business.

So she is motivated to request a loan that will be invested in the purchase of a over-lock sewing machine, a cover stitch machine and a flat-bed sewing machine. This will allow her to set her business project in motion with the hope of generating a big impact in the sector so that it generates a favorable profit and fulfills her dream of positioning herself in the market. With her drive and ambition she sees herself in the medium term generating employment always working hand in hand with the Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a over-lock sewing machine, a cover stitch machine and a flat-bed sewing machine.

loans.name: Santilata

texts.en:
Santilata is a resident of Muniguda village of Rayagada district, Odisha, India. She is 33 years old. She has a small family: her husband and only one child. 

She and her husband are engaged with the occupation of tailoring and a spice item business at her own home village. Santilata is a very good tailor with a specialization in stitching blouses. 

No doubt she has everything as per the required basic necessities of life: a two wheeler, a good shop and other allied items to manage her family. Still, her family members are not happy. Why? Due to no availability of an owned house.

At present they are staying at a rented house. The current house is made from lower standard brick and roofed with asbestos, which creates a very critical situation during the rainy season. The most important thing is the apprehensive house is completely not secure and safe.

In this situation, she decided to construct a house for better living standards. For house construction, the fund requirement is more, and that is the main concern of Santilata. She decided to borrow a loan from any bank or other financial institution. At this moment, Santilata came to Mahashakti Foundation to know about house loan details. Mahashakti Foundation decided to disburse a loan for house construction. 

She is very happy to know that her house will be complete within a few days, and she will be proud to have a good, owned house in the society.

loans.use: to construct her own house

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es viuda y vive sola porque sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya formaron sus familias y uno vive en Estados Unidos. 

Josefina, se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace más de 15 años, cuando enviudo comenzó este negocio, pero además de eso trabaja limpiando casas, para lo cual tiene que desplazar hasta la ciudad que está a 10 kilómetros de distancia y este trabajo lo realiza 2 veces por semana.  

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos y para comprar cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos; de esta manera sus ingresos aumentaran considerablemente.  

Josefina, quiere seguir trabajando de la manera que lo está haciendo, ya que de esa manera ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante; también quiere contribuir a la crianza de sus nietos y el sueño más grande que tiene es verlos crecer.
texts.en:
Josefina, 54 years old, is a hardworking woman who has studied through the fourth year of school. She is a widow and lives alone because her children are grown and have already formed their families – and one lives in the United States.  

For more than 15 years, Josefina has made a living raising chickens. She started this business when she was widowed, but besides this she also works cleaning houses for which she has to travel 10 kilometers outside the city. She does this job twice a week. 

The loan she is asking for is to purchase concentrate and vitamins for her chickens and to buy pigs in order to fatten and sell them. This way, her income will increase considerably.  

Josefina wants to continue working as she has been, as it has allowed her to provide for her children. She also wants to contribute to the upbringing of her grandchildren, and her greatest dream is to see them grow.

loans.use: to buy concentrate and vitamins for chickens and buy pigs.

loans.name: Maixanne

texts.fr: Maixanne, 51 ans, est veuve et mère de trois enfants. Depuis la mort de son mari, il y a dix ans de cela, elle s’occupe seule de sa famille grâce aux revenus de son petit commerce de produits alimentaires. Elle vend du riz, du sucre, de la farine, etc. A l’aide du microcrédit, elle a beaucoup développé son activité en augmentant son stock à chaque fois. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des caisses d’huile et des boites de beurre de cuisine.
texts.en:
Maixanne is 51 years old; she is widowed with three children. Since her husband’s death, ten years ago, she has taken care of her family by herself, thanks to revenues from her grocery retail activity. She sells rice, sugar, flour, etc.

With help from microloans, she has greatly expanded her business by increasing her stock every time. She is requesting a loan to purchase boxes of cooking oil and butter.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cooking oil and butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Joseph Jacques

texts.fr: Jacques a 47 ans. Il est marié et il a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il est tailleur et cela fait 20 ans qu’il exerce dans ce domaine. Grâce à cette activité, il arrive à prendre soin de sa famille. Voulant éviter une rupture de stock, il a sollicité un microcrédit pour acheter des tissus et augmenter sa production de vêtements. Jacques veut augmenter son revenu et pouvoir épargner pour les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jacques is 47 years old. He is married and has four children, who all go to school.

He is a tailor and has been in this business for twenty years. Thanks to this activity, he can take care of his family. To avoid going out of stock, he requested a microloan with which to buy fabrics and increase his clothing production.

Jacques wants to increase his revenues to be able to save for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rolls of toilet paper and boxes of toothpaste.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, sand and cement to drill a water well.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: La señora Mary Luz actualmente ya no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja ya que ella se divorció hace varios años, la señora continua trabajando para seguir adelante y no depender de nadie, sus hijos le colaboran pero ella ya no quiere que le ayuden ya que una de sus nietas esta delicada de salud y uno de sus hijos esta con gastos fuertes para su recuperación, la señora Maria solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería para su tienda de tal manera que pueda  abastecerse para mejorar sus ventas y así podrá seguir con su actividad para cubrir sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mary Luz currently does not have the support of her husband, as she has been divorced for several years. 

She has continued working to get ahead in life and does not depend upon anyone. Her children help her, but she does not want them to help as one of her granddaughters is in poor health and one of her sons now has large expenses due to her recovery. 

Mary is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her store so she can stock it and improve her sales – and thus be able to continue with her business in order to cover expenses and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store to improve sales.

loans.name: Ana Nervy

texts.es:
Trabajar por vivir mejor es lo que se ha dedicado la señora Ana, una mujer de 32 años de edad, que con su dinamismo y positivismo ha sacado su negocio adelante,  es madre de un muchacho de 8 años de edad, inicio su negocio pro vacación al trabajo independiente y tener la disponibilidad para atender cualquier necesidad que se presente con su hijo.

Ana tiene un negocio particular en Medellín el cual es una papelería donde paralelo vende productos de aseo y cuidado personal.

Ana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos que le permitan diversificar la mercancía exhibida, quiere incorporar lociones, desodorantes, talcos, y resurtir la papelería.

Su sueño es solo uno, salir adelante, permitirse crecer y convertir sanamente con los negocios a nivel municipal.
texts.en:
Ana has dedicated herself to a better life through working.  She is 32 years old and her dynamism and positivity have pushed her business ahead.  She is the mother of an 8-year-old boy.  She started her business so that she could work independently and be available to attend to the needs of her son.  

Ana has a private business in Medellín, which is a stationer's shop where she also sells toiletries and personal care products.  

Ana wants to request a loan to buy products that will allow her to diversify her merchandise, such as lotion, deodorant, and powder, and to restock her stationary shop.  

She has only one dream, to get ahead, and allow herself to grow and change in a healthy way with her business ventures at the municipal level.

loans.use: to buy products that will allow her to diversify her merchandise, such as lotion, deodorant, and powder, and to restock her stationary shop.

loans.name: Senilda Isabel

texts.es:
Senilda es una de las orgullosas agricultoras colombianas, ella heredó el cultivo de sus padres y ahora estos terrenos se han convertido en el sustento familiar de ella, su esposo y su hijo el cual espera que adquiera los conocimientos para ocupar su lugar en el cultivo.

Senilda hasta en una etapa de transición y mantenimiento de su cultivo ya que múltiples sucesos como paro de camineros, sequías han afectado sus cultivos, obligándola gastar su capital en la plantación de nuevos terrenos y el sostenimiento de su hogar en esas fechas difíciles.

Por esta Razón Senilda quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas de mantenimiento, asistencia técnica para la plantación de cultivo, y riegos.
texts.en:
Senilda is a proud Columbian farmer who inherited her field from her parents, and now these lands have been converted into the family sustenance for her, her husband, and her son, who she hopes will learn enough to take her place on the farm.  

Senilda is in a transitional and maintenance stage with her crops, since multiple events such as the road workers' strike and droughts have affected her crops, forcing her to waste capital on planting new land and sustaining her household in these difficult times.  
 
For these reasons, Senilda wants to apply for a loan to buy agricultural inputs for crop maintenance, technical assistance for crop planting, and irrigation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for crop maintenance, technical assistance for crop planting, and irrigation.

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, una persona solitaria que se valió de sus habilidades en la confección para generar el sustento con el que paga el arriendo, alimentación, transporte y servicios públicos.

Adriana no tiene hijos, solo sus máquinas y unas enormes ganas por salir adelante, por ello piensa en grande y no se detiene.

Adriana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una maquina recubridora, su pensando es llegar a tender un mayor número de producción y mejorar sus tiempos de confección.
texts.en:
Adriana is a hard-working, hard-fighting woman, a solitary person who values her dressmaking skills to generate the income that she uses to pay for rent, food, transportation, and public services.  

Adriana doesn't have children, just her machines and an enormous desire to get ahead, because she thinks big and doesn't waste time.  

Adriana wants to apply for a loan to buy a covering machine, keeping in mind that she wants to increase her production and improve her dressmaking time.

loans.use: to buy a covering machine, keeping in mind that she wants to increase her production and improve her dressmaking time

loans.name: Resglan

texts.en:
Resglan is 27 years old and has three children. Resglan is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Resglan is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Resglan requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Resglan has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Resglan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia Aurelia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,a la crianza de animales y tambien a la elaboracion de jora, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
