Aurelia continues working in her grocery store, raising animals and making jora (corn beer). She sells basic need items like rice, sugar milk and cookies. She wants to get ahead through her business. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.

Aurelia is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. She is happy for the loan and promises to pay the installments on her loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is 52 years old and he lives in the village of Gagarin in the Gegharkunik region. Ivan used to work as a factory worker but now he is a farmer. Ivan’s wife works at the canned food factory and after work she helps her husband on their farm. Ivan has cows and calves and he manages to sell a lot of milk, macun (national dairy product) and meat. Ivan wants very much to increase the number of his farm cattle and he will be thankful if Kiva lenders will help him to buy a cow for his farm and also fodder for all his cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his farm and also fodder for all his cattle

loans.name: Olinda

texts.pt:
A senhora  Olinda de 56 anos é cozinheira numa empresa de ramo agricola e social que atende a criancas orfas da zona, viuva de 04 filhos, dos quais 3 a estudar e 1 ja maior de idade, sustenta ainda 2 netos dos quais 1 é orfao e vivem com ela na casa propria.
Diz que com este credito ira comprar cimento, arros, areia, varrões e pedra para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa tipo 1. 
Diz que seu sonho é ampliar a sua casa com mais dois quartos e mobilar uma vez que vive numa tipo 1 e e obrigada a dormir com seus filhos.
Diz que a insuficiencia de fundos para supera-los, faz xitique e tem machambas onde produz para o sustento familiar diz que ira solicitar mais credito.
texts.en:
Olinda is 56 years old and works as a cook at an agribusiness company and as a social worker helping orphaned children in the area in which she lives. She is widowed with four children, three of whom are in school and one of whom is already an adult. She also helps care for two grandchildren who live with her, one of whom is an orphan.

Olinda will use this loan to buy cement, rings, sand, metal bars, and stone in order to continue a construction project on her small one-bedroom house. Her goal is to expand her house by building two more rooms and furnishing them, since she currently lives in a one-bedroom house and has to sleep in the same room as her children.

Olinda's main challenge has been a lack of funds to reach her goals, but she participates in the Mozambican communal loan system known as xitique and she has a small garden plot where she grows food for her family's everyday needs. She also plans to take out more loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy cement, rings, sand, metal bars, and stone.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is 27 years old. She runs a kiosk in front of her house. Domingas lives in a town near the school and her kiosk is well located where many people come to buy, including students. 

Domingas is applying for a loan of $1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) to buy stock for her store, including milk, water, Fanta, Coca-Cola, coffee, sugar, salt and fish. She makes good money from her business and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk, water, Fanta, Coca-Cola, coffee, sugar, salt and fish.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta lives in Liquisa; she is married and has 2 children. She has plans to repair her house, but now she does not have enough money to buy all the materials. Jacinta is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin so that she can buy more materials such as wood, cement, stone, sand, iron, ceramics, nails, etc. The loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin will allow her to complete her house.

loans.use: To buy wood, cement, stone, sand, iron, ceramics, nails and other materials.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a married mother of two children, both attending school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past eight years, Biasha has operated a business selling clothes from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

Biasha will use her loan of KES 20,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, a farmer in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, is a 53-year-old mother of seven children. Three of her children are dependent on her and one of them is still in school. Yon grows rice on a two-hectare area of farmland as her main source of income and sometimes threshes rice for others for a fee. Yon has been farming for about 35 years already. 

Yon's previous, and first cycle, loan enabled her to earn about 33,300 KHR per day to improve her living conditions. Her farming business is high risk because of the lack of water and destruction by pests. Yon requested a second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to buy fertilizer for her cash crop and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to improve her business and get high crop yields to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash crop and to pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en: Jeralyn, 39 years old, is married and has three children, one of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past ten years, Jeralyn has operated a food market business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall. In the future, Jeralyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 60 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Gloria has operated a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Degrasian

texts.en: Degrasian, who is in her 40s, is married with four children. She has been running a cereals business for 26 years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. This will be Degrasian's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more cereals and has paid back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, pay rent for the shop, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of cereals, especially rice. She dreams of building her own house. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cereals, especially rice.

loans.name: Flordenia

texts.en:
Flordenia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food-vending business.

Flordenia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cindy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cindy, de 28 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad y está embarazada, su pareja se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y de sandía.

Cindy, tiene 6 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, anteriormente trabaja en una tienda en la ciudad, pero debido a que ganaba muy poco dejo de trabajar y decidió dedicar su tiempo a cultivar la tierra, donde ella tiene sus cultivos está a 1 kilómetro y medio de la casa y se desplaza en una bicicleta.

Cindy, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, con este préstamo sus necesidades serán satisfechas y podrá prepara la tierra a tiempo, para asegurar una buena cosecha.  

Los sueños de Cindy son, sembrar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y que sus hijos puedan tener un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Cindy is 28 years old. She is in a relationship, has a four year old child and is pregnant. Her partner works growing basic grains and watermelon.

Cindy has worked for six years growing corn. Before that she worked in a store in the city but as she made very little money she left her work and decided to spend her time working the land. Her crops are one km from her house and she gets there by bicycle.

Cindy needs the loan to buy fertilizer and agricultural inputs for her crops. the loan will satisfy her needs and she will be able to prepare the land in time to be assured of a good harvest.

Cindy's dreams are to plant 21,000 square meters of corn and for her children to have a good future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and agricultural inputs for her crops.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang, 45 years old, lives in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of four children, two of them dependent on her and one still in school. For the past 27 years, Nang's main source of income has come from growing rice on two hectares of farmland. She sometimes works for pay in order to earn additional income to support her family. 

Nang's income has decreased because her business is being threatened due to low soil nutrients and destruction by pests. She is requesting a second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), having repaid her past loan successfully. Nang will use the new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can increase her crop productivity to earn more income to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: This loan of $1,000 USD  will allow  to Norberta to send her daughter to primary school. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Norberta loves her daughter very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en: Tehmine is 32 years old and she lives with children and her husband in the Ddmashen village in the Gegharkunik region. Tehmine has a higher pedagogical education and she works in her specialty at the local school. Tehmine’s husband is also employed. Both of them are also engaged in farming and agriculture and they also care for their farm cattle. Tehmine’s children are still small and they go to kindergarten. Tehmine has requested a loan and will be pleased if Kiva lenders support her. She has some health problems and she needs to pass a medical examination.  She asks for this loan of 250,000 AMD to help solve her her health problems.

loans.use: to solve her health problems

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as social. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, handbags and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes, handbags and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes, handbags and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom to improve access to sanitation and water

loans.name: Rueben

texts.en: This is Rueben, a farmer from Nakuru county. He keeps dairy cows, sheep and goats and cultivates maize and beans, which are staple foods in most Kenyan homes. Rueben has been farming for the last 10 years and he is very happy with the results. He sells his produce in the local Nakuru market. However, he wants to expand his market share by hiring transport to other long distant markets that will give better prices for his produce. This Kiva loan will enable Rueben to cultivate more of his land and hire transport for his produce.

loans.use: To pay for cultivation of his land and transport of supplies to different markets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.en: A 1,000 USD loan is offered to Octavia to improve her business. Octavia opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own work. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like shirts, pants, and pillows. Octavia is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Octavia is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants and pillows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 7 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la vende en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos del hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young borrower, whose face is blurred, is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She cultivates corn and beans.  She has 7 years of experience in farming. When her harvest is ready,she sells it in the places surrounding the area where she lives.  With the earnings from her crops, she manages to cover the household expenses. 

This young borrower lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and other supplies to improve the land that is shown in the photograph so that she can continue with her work and have more income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a widow with four children and lives in a six-room apartment house in the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced a lot of challenges in her life, such as the death of her husband and that of her child, the loss of her things to armed robbers, and the death of some of her chicks. She has a strong hold that this business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time and she has steady customers.

With the new loan requested, she will buy chicks, feed, and medication for the chicks. This activity will actively help the community, in that people around will not need to travel far distances to buy. She will also provide manure for farmers in the community.

The profit from the activity will be used to increase the size of her poultry, give proper education to her children, and provide medication for the family in any case of ill health. She rather prefers a loan from GHAPE because the interest rate is low, the method of repayment is very simple, and the rules are easy to follow.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed, and medication for the chicks.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedita is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Mercedita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sizela

texts.en: This loan of $1,000 USD will allow Sizela to send her daughter to secondary school. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Sizela loves her daughter very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, 45 years old, lives in Nyabikamba, Kitagwenda in the Kamwenge district. He is married and has six children who are all in school. Robert's main source of income is his butchery; he also rears cattle as an alternative source of income. 

Robert has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to help him to buy more cows for slaughtering. This will help him to meet his customers' demand since he is assured of the market and it will also increase his income. Robert will use the rest of the money to pay for his children's school fees. Robert is a very honest and hardworking man. He appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for giving him a financial boost.

loans.use: To boost his business by buying cattle for slaughter

loans.name: Sroun's Group

texts.en:
Sroun, a farmer living in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, is a married mother of three children. She struggles for a living by growing rice, and also harvests rice products for others for a fee to supplement her income. Sroun has been in this business for 43 years. Unfortunately, this year her crop cannot produce a good output because of lack of water to support growth. 

Sroun is leading a three-member group to take out a new loan, and this will be her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sroun will use her loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to buy a pumping machine for her rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Norali

texts.es:
Norali es una mujer pujante y trabajadora de 52 años de edad, una persona que lucha por un mejor futuro, que quiere ver su hogar organizado, poder disfrutar un buen alimento, y todo ello lo ha logrado con su tienda de abarrotes, negocio que para ella representa fortaleza, sostenibilidad y proyección.

Norali es madre de dos hijos adolescentes, se ha trazado una meta la cual es comprar una vivienda propia y tanto sus hijos, como ella y su pareja trabajan para lograr algún día cumplir este sueño.


Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar,   diversificara su oferta con productos de aseo personal, aseo doméstico, bebidas y cerveza.
texts.en:
Norali, at 52 years old, is a thriving and hardworking woman who fights for a better future. She wants to have an organized home and enjoy good nutrition. She has achieved all this through her grocery store, a business that she feels is representative of fortitude, sustainability, and impact.

Norali is the mother of two teenagers. She has devised a plan to buy a house for herself and her children, and she and her partner work toward one day fulfilling this dream.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of basic items, and to diversify her offering of personal hygiene items, home cleaning products, beverages, and beer.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic items, and to diversify her offering of personal hygiene items, home cleaning products, beverages, and beer.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as candles, slippers, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, noodles, fish and beer. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Agatha is living in a town near the school, and her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy.

loans.use: To buy candles, slippers, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, noodles, fish and beer

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 15 años y gracia a ese trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Julio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga, pesticidas entres otros, para poder continuar con sus cultivos y tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio is 45 years old and lives in his own house with his son. He has made a living cultivating corn for the last 15 years, and this work has kept him moving forward. When his harvest is ready, he stocks it into silos, like the one shown in the photo, and then sells it in the areas around where he lives.

Julio is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, pesticides, and others, in order to continue his farming and have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, pesticides, and others.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is 38 years old and has four children. Ma. Linda is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Ma. Linda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Linda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Linda has been in pig fattening for 15 years now.

Ma. Linda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van, born in 1980, is a Thai ethnic woman who has been a member of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2005. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her two children are both obedient and good at learning; one is in grade 4 and one is in kindergarten. 

Van's family's income is mainly based on cultivation and breeding. After deducting costs, it is just enough to cover living expenses and save a small amount of money, which is not enough to pay for her children’s education fees. Therefore, Van wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Van will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan will help her children have good conditions for learning, and then they will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education fees

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu, born in 1973, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has five members, including her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and a child of her son. The family is living in the Mai Son district in the Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivating corn and rice. The income is about VND 40 to 50 million. However, the income is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and to save a small amount. She wants to buy corn stock for the next crop but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan will help her family buy good corn stock, and that the next corn crop will bring her family twice as much production as the previous year.

loans.use: to buy corn stock

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 60 years old and a widow with three children.  With two children in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thoan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoan, 32 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has three members, including her husband, her daughter and herself. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation, so the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover their living expenses and save a small amount.  Because she has to pay for her daughter’s education fee, the saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coffee field. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively in the coffee field, and that this crop will bring her family a yield which is twice as much as the previous year. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is married and has 2 children. She describes herself to be goal-oriented. For the past 3 years, Getrude has operated a retail business where she prints designs on shirts and also makes stamps. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are good. Getrude describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Getrude will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of materials for making stamps and printed shirts. She hopes that, in the future, the business will grow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of materials for making stamps and printed shirts

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en: Enriqueta, 54 years old, is married and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past two years, Enriqueta has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell. In the future, Enriqueta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en: A 1,000 USD loan is offered to Agusta to improve her business.She is married and she started her garden in 2009 with her own effort. She will use the loan to buy powder (fertilizer). Agusta is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Agusta is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy powder (fertilizer)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, pictured above on the right, is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells solar products to rural communities in Kenya. She is 39 years old, married, and has four children. Her sons are 19 and 9 years old and her daughters are 16 and 12 years old. Gladys places the utmost importance in her children's education, as all of her children are very active and performing well in school. 

Gladys has been working for the Fasiseka Savings And Credit Co-operative (SACCO - much like a credit union) for 10 years. Fasiseka's initiative is to assist over 2,000 members to procure iron sheets, iron boxes and solar equipment. Gladys realized that many of the members of SACCO to whom she sells are tea farmers who are off the electricity grid, hence a huge need for solar products. She has been educating members of SACCO on the importance, functionality and benefits of solar products. Gladys already has a passion for solar products as she has experience in selling them. 

A Kiva loan will allow Gladys to purchase 30 solar kits and 10 One Degree Solar light bulbs. This will allow her to increase her inventory, serve more customers, scale her business, and earn more money to ensure all her children get a great education. Gladys' long-term goal is to continue to purchase One Degree Solar products as members of SACCO increase and there is a larger demand for solar products.

loans.use: To provide solar products to sell primarily to off-grid rural tea farmers.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre soltero sin hijos de 57 años que ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura en un terrenos que fueron heredados de su familia.

Al vivir solo ha tenido que a través múltiples momentos difíciles y no ha encontrado en quien apoyarse, pero ahora es diferente Interactuar está dispuesto a estirarle la mano para ayudarle y colaborarle junto con su socio Kiva en un préstamo que necesita para incentivar su profesión y mantener su cultivo

Con el préstamo que está solicitando Miguel quiere comprar abonos, riegos, venenos y alambre para cercar sus terrenos protegiéndolos de animales e incluso personas.
texts.en:
Miguel is a single 57 year old man with no children who has dedicated all his life to agriculture on land that was inherited from his family. He has lived alone through many difficult times and without finding support, but now it is different. Interactuar is willing to lend a hand to help and collaborate with Kiva in a loan that he needs to stimulate his business and maintain his crop.

With the loan that he is requesting, Miguel wants to purchase fertilizer, irrigation, pest control, and wire to fence his land to protect it from animals and even people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation, pest control, and wire to fence the land to protect it from animals and even people.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Son, 22 years old, is a Thai ethnic man. His family has three members, including his wife, his lovely son and himself. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

His family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. He can sell from one to two herds of pigs, and cultivate several tons of coffee each year, equivalent to VND 65 to 70 million. However, the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and to save a small amount. He wants to buy fertilizer for the next coffee crop but that saved amount is not enough. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

Son hopes that the loan will help his family have good conditions to tend the coffee field well. Next year, the coffee field will bring his family an abundant crop, and then he will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Julio Victor

texts.es: JULIO VICTOR: Es un señor sonriente y amable, originario de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 51 años de edad, casado,  tiene 5 hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y dos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Su esposa es ama de casa. Desde hace 17 años habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera, con el propósito de reparar el techo de su casita, está solicitando financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción como: madera, zinc,  clavos y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir el corredor de su vivienda y el muro perimetral del patio, para brindarle a su familia mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Julio Victor is a smiling and kind man, originally from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. Three of them are older and two are teenagers who study in secondary school. His wife is a homemaker. 

For 17 years he has lived in a wood house built on stilts. In order to repair the roof of his home, he is requesting financing to purchase construction materials like wood, zinc, nails, and cover the costs of labor. His dream is to construct a corridor on his home and a perimeter wall for the patio, to provide better security for his family.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his home built from wood on stilts.

loans.name: Harfel Jane

texts.en:
Harfel Jane is 24 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Harfel Jane has a pottery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery.

Harfel Jane has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery.

loans.name: Quan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quan is a Thai ethnic woman who has been participating in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2011. She is living with her husband and her lovely son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. The annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coffee for the next crop but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

She hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively in the coffee, and then this year, the coffee field will be laden with fruits, bringing an abundant crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Pamila

texts.en:
Pamila is 41 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Pamila works very hard to provide for them.

Pamila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like detergent soap, bread, cooking oil, sugar, salt, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Pamila has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, bread, cooking oil, sugar, salt, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Pamila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like detergent soap, bread, cooking oil, sugar, salt, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Leditha

texts.en:
Leditha works hard to support her family. Leditha is married and has a business buying and selling recyclable materials business in the Philippines.

Leditha requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

Leditha has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Leditha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Segundo Tobias

texts.es:
Segundo es un señor de 56 años, vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad conocida en el país porque habita la etnia Tsáchila, por ello el nombre de la ciudad.
Segundo es un señor muy trabajador, a pesar de haber perdido hace años atrás su fuente de trabajo que era un bus, donde lo asaltaron y lo dejaron mal herido,  no se dejó en caer, tuvo mucho el apoyo de su esposa quien le ayudó a superar esta etapa. Poco a poco fueron vendiendo variedades y salieron adelante, actualmente cuenta con un vehículo donde realiza fletes a diferentes partes del país, le ha ido muy bien, gracias a este ingreso su pequeña está estudiando.
Segundo ya recibió un crédito en Fundación Alternativa, ahora por su buen comportamiento de pagos pudo recibir otro, con el primer crédito él pudo mejorar su vehículo y seguir con el negocio, ahora incluso comenta que le fue tan bien que pudo fortalecer su otro ingreso, el del comercio de artículos para el hogar en donde le apoya su esposa recorriendo tres veces a la semana; con este crédito podrán capitalizarse e invertir en mercadería para seguir creciendo y abrirse en otras zonas.
Se siente feliz porque como microempresario se ha superado gracias a los créditos de KIVA, así ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 56-year-old gentleman. He lives together with his wife and their little daughter in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city known throughout the country as home of the ethnic Tsáchila, for whom the city was named.

Segundo is a very hardworking man. Despite having lost his source of work (a bus) in an assault years back that left him badly injured, he did not stay down. He had a lot of support from his wife, who helped him overcome that period. Little by little, they got by by selling a variety of items. Currently, he has a vehicle with which he transports goods to different parts of the country. That has been going very well for him; thanks to that income, his little one is in school.

Segundo already received one loan from Fundación Alternativa. Now, because of his good repayment behavior, he was able to receive another. With the first loan, he was able to make improvements to his vehicle and continue with his business. Now, he says that it went so well that he was even able to strengthen his other source of income, the sale of household goods, in which his wife helps him by making rounds three times a week. With this loan, he will be able to have capital to invest in merchandise to keep growing and to expand to other areas.

He feels happy because he has improved himself as a micro-businessman thanks to the loans from Kiva, thereby improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his household goods business, which his wife helps him with, so that they can use the extra income to continue growing

loans.name: Phua's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phua, born in 1986, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been participating in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2006. She is always one of the exemplary members in complying with the regulations and policies of M7-MFI. She currently lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation of coffee, so the annual income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the whole family and to save a small amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coffee but that saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes the loan will help her family invest effectively in the coffee field, and then the coming crop will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 47 years old, married, and has four children.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maricel has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ngoan's Group

texts.en:
Ngoan, 24 years old, is a Thai ethnic man. He is living with his wife and his lovely daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. His family’s main income is from cultivation, and the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and to save a small amount. Since the time when he moved to live separately from his parents, and because the main income is mostly based on crop, it depends a lot on the result of each harvest. Therefore, he still cannot have enough money to repair his house. That is why he wants to borrow a loan to buy materials to repair his house.

Ngoan hopes a lot that the loan will help him to repair the house to make it more spacious and clean. He will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his house

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hanh, born in 1980, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband, her daughter and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family lives mainly based on breeding and cultivation, so the annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and to save a small amount. Unfortunately, her daughter is facing a renal failure, so the saved amount is not enough to pay for her daughter to get a medical check and treatment. Therefore, Hanh wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her daughter have the necessary medical check and treatment, and then her daughter will soon be recovered from the renal failure. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's medical check and treatment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, vive en una comunidad en el área rural, sus hijos estudian en las unidades educativas del municipio y como madre quiere lo mejor para ellos, la señora se dedica a la agricultura porque es lo único que aprendió con sus progenitores. El año 2014 sufrió una disminución en sus ingresos económicos por los bajos precios de los productos agrícolas y también por las lluvias que le echaron a perder sus plantaciones de tomate y la granizada daño sus sembradíos. Por estos motivos solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas que se requieren para la producción y para la alimentación de sus hijos, de esta forma continuara con su actividad y podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old. She is a single mother, and she has four children who depend on her income. She lives in a community in a rural area. Her children study at the town public schools, and as their mother, she wants the best for them. Victoria makes a living in agriculture because that is the only thing that she learned from her parents.

In 2014, she suffered a decrease in her income as a result of the low prices of agricultural products and also because the rain ruined her tomato crops and the hail damaged her harvest. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy the agricultural supplies needed for production and for the nourishment of her children. This way, she will continue with her work, and she will be able to cover the cost of her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural supplies needed for production and for the nourishment of her children.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad is a 23-year-old married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his wife in a small house. A few years ago, Zeyad started his own business, which is a barber shop. He took this experience from his previous job. His business is very good and he is well known in his area.

Zeyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop. By taking this loan, Zeyad will be able to renew part of his shop and improve it.

Zeyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and hair products for his barber shop.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 58 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Monina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Monina requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Monina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Kalee

texts.en:
Kalee is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wilma is 41 years old and has three children who are in school.

Wilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Wilma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nunung

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Nunung, one of Ruma’s agents. Nunung lives in Cianjur, located in West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her three children.

By supporting this loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Nunung's shop. This will allow Nunung to become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product called "Mapan," designed for lower-income communities. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Nunung, and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children.

As a Mapan agent, Nunung is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts, as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Nunung will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Nunung believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with lower prices.

Nunung is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to have additional working capital to facilitate the introduction of Ruma's new savings plan for low-income communities.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 54 years old and married with four children. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Naphokham Group

texts.en: Vongvichit is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.  Vongvichit and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Vongvichit and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Vongvichit and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Vongvichit and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Smith Alejandro

texts.es:
Smith es un joven de 18 años, vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Santo Domingo.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres él ha podido superarse y salir adelante, comenta que desde que estaba en el colegio sus padres le inculcaron a que debe esforzarse para conseguir algo en la vida, desde ahí comenzó a vender ropa a compañeros, luego con estos ingresos él iba ayudando con los ingresos en el hogar, incluso está ahorrando para empezar a estudiar en la universidad.
Smith es un cliente fiel a la Fundación, este ya es su segundo crédito el mismo que lo va a invertir en mercadería en ropa porque  en la ciudad donde él vive está de fiesta de cantonización y es una muy buena temporada para el comercio. Agradece a las instituciones que pueden apoyar a jóvenes trabajadores como él ya que no en cualquier institución confían en gente de corta edad.
Smith desea seguir superándose y seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en:
Smith is an 18-year-old young man. He lives with his parents in the city of Santo Domingo.

Thanks to his parents' support, he has been able to better himself and succeed in life. He says that, ever since he was in high school, his parents ingrained in him that he should work hard to acheive something in life.

From there, he started selling clothes to classmates. Later, with that income, he helped with the household income, including saving to start college.

Smith is a loyal client of the Foundation. This is already his second loan, which he is going to invest in clothing merchandise. The city where he lives is celebrating its cantonization [similar to statehood], and it is a very good time of year for sales. He is grateful to the institutions that can help young workers like him. Not every institution trusts workers so young.

Smith wants to continue improving himself and growing his business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and attend college with the savings

loans.name: Mailek 9 Group

texts.en: Nae’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Nae and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Nae and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Nae’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jose Rafael

texts.es: José de 33 años de edad habita en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando actualmente. José es un hombre trabajador que presta sus servicios a una empresa distribuidora de de huevos y lácteos durante los días de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, gracias a su alto desempeño a adquirido una gran experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias para suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. José pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para hacer la inversión en el encementando del patio de su casa ya que en épocas seca  le  genera demasiado polvo que afecta la salud de su familia ocasionándoles enfermedades respiratorias, con el monto solicitado comprara: piedra, cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
33-year-old José lives in a house he owns, along with his two children who are 14 and 7 years old. They currently attend school.

José is a hard-working man who offers his services to an egg and milk distribution business on the weekdays. On the weekends, he works buying and selling livestock.

Thanks to his high performance, he has acquired great sales experience, which allows him to earn the best income in order to supply the basic household necessities.

Thinking of the well-being of his children, Jose has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in cementing his house's patio. In the dry season, it generates too much dust, affecting his family's health by causing them respiratory illnesses. With the requested loan, he will buy stone, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy stone, cement, sand, and gravel to put in cement for his house's patio

loans.name: Nathom Group

texts.en:
Vanh understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Vanh knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Vanh purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Vanh is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is 39 years old and married with two children who are in school. He lives in a rural area of Kajonjo, Kitagwenda in Kamwenge district. He deals in coffee farming and production as his main source of income. He also has a five-acre coffee plantation where he harvests coffee for sale. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to help him buy more coffee from farmers to add to his store so that he can sell in bulk, increasing his profit. His major challenge is long drought that affects his coffee plantation.

He hopes to build a permanent home for his children after making more profits. He is a hardworking and focused man. He looks forward to a longer partnership.

loans.use: To boost his coffee trade

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Mable lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, both of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 16 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and also start farming. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Nadee Group

texts.en:
Chai and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  

The water filter Chai and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Chai and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Chai and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

Chai is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonxay Group

texts.en:
Sompo’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  

Sompo and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Sompo’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Sompo and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nanmty Group

texts.en:
Wangyevong understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Wangyevong knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. 

The water filter Wangyevong purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Wangyevong is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat is a responsible woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is a widow and has two children. 

After her husband’s death she felt difficulties with ensuring her children's care alone. 

She is busy with buying and selling rice. She has four years of practice of doing business. She additionally plants rice at her land that brings her income to feed her family. She likes her business and is satisfied to be a client of IMON. 

Some month ago her mother died. Now she is needed to do her mother’s funeral. She asked for a loan to do her mother’s funeral. She awaits Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to do her mother’s funeral

loans.name: Vunghin Group

texts.en: Ta is excited that the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Ta and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter that Ta and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Ta and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Ta and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Nadee Group

texts.en: Vanhsone understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Vanhsone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter which Vanhsone purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Vanhsone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Phonvilay Group

texts.en:
Chiathongxong and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  

Chiathongxong and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Chiathongxong and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Chiathongxong and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Chiathongxong is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Redemter

texts.en:
Redemter is 34 years old, married to Evans, and she supports three children. She has been keeping rabbits for the last four years and the business earns her KES 6,500 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase timbers for making a hutch, as well as rabbit feeds to enable the rabbits to grow fat and grow faster for sale. 

She plans to use the gained profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, as well as to educate her children and provide them with better medication. Her hope is to improve her standard of living and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase timbers for making a hutch and rabbit feeds so as to enable the rabbits to grow fat and grow faster for sale.
